0.title: Star responds to third umpire controversies with a holographic statue
0.article_body: Amidst the controversies surrounding third umpires, Cadbury 5 Star has set up a holographic statue of third umpire C. K. Nandan outside a cricket stadium in South Mumbai. According to the brand, third umpires are legends because they hold the most power in the game by doing almost nothing, and this gesture is their way of giving them their due.

1.title: Not a day goes by where Muslims don't get targeted: Owaisi
1.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi called BJP an anti-Muslim party and said that BJP has announced war against Muslims. He also criticised Samajwadi Party and said, "In UP, today 100 years old Madrassas' 50 years old structure was bulldozed but the Samajwadi Party will not speak." Not a single day goes by where Muslims don't get targeted, he added.

2.title: GT's Sai Sudharsan becomes 1st player to get out hit wicket in IPL 2022, IPL share video
2.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) batter Sai Sudharsan on Friday became the first player to get out hit wicket in IPL 2022. MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard bowled a slow bouncer, which Sudharsan tried to pull but missed. In his follow-through, Sudharsan lost his balance and mistakenly hit the stumps with his bat. He got out for 14(11).

3.title: India reports 3,805 new COVID-19 cases, active cases exceed 20,000
3.article_body: India has reported 3,805 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,545 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 20,303, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,024, according to the latest data.

4.title: He is accusing me to make money: Afridi on Kaneria's 'He conspired against me' remark
4.article_body: Ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has responded after former leg-spinner Danish Kaneria alleged that Afridi conspired against him for being a Hindu. Afridi said, "He's accusing me to get cheap fame and make money." He added, "Everyone knows about his character. If my attitude was bad then why he didn't complain to...Pakistan Cricket Board or the department he was playing for."

5.title: Fulfilled a lifelong dream to see him in person: Vikrant shares pic with Ajay
5.article_body: Actor Vikrant Massey took to Instagram to share a picture of himself with Ajay Devgn. "Fulfilled a lifelong dream to see him in person. Some things are worth the wait," he captioned the post. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "He's a legend and you're one already in the making Vikrant." "Hard work always pays off," another fan said.

6.title: Investment bank Jefferies CEO's Instagram account hacked
6.article_body: Investment bank Jefferies Financial Group has said the Instagram account of its CEO Rich Handler has been hacked. "Any stories related to discounted sales of shares, crypto donations or donations to Ukraine...that appear on that hacked Instagram account are categorically false," Jefferies said. It is working with Instagram-owner Meta to get back control of the social media account.

7.title: Ex-AAP councillor Hussain was active rioter in 2020 Delhi riots: Court
7.article_body: A Delhi court said that former AAP councillor Tahir Hussain "was not only a mere conspirator but an active rioter also" in connection with a 2020 Delhi riots case. The court also ordered the framing of charges against Hussain. "The building of accused...used by the rioters...for brick bating, stone pelting, pelting of petrol bombs, acid bombs etc," the court added.

8.title: BBMP to float tenders for installation of air pollution monitors
8.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) will float tenders to install air pollution monitors across the city, a senior BBMP official said. "We do not have technical expertise in this area. We are working with Karnataka State Pollution Control Board in this regard," he said. "The plan was to set up air pollution monitors in each ward," he added.

9.title: No one can take our freedom away: P Chidambaram
9.article_body: On the occasion of 101st foundation day of Tilak Maharashtra Vidyapeeth, former Finance Minister P Chidambaram said, "Lokmanya Tilak has given freedom to India with the help of a four-point agenda of Swadeshi, Swarajya, boycott and national teaching." He added, "Though we are denied the right to agitate or express our opinion today, no one can take our freedom away."

10.title: Alleged secret lover of Putin included in proposed EU sanctions list: Reports
10.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's alleged secret lover, Alina Kabaeva, has been included in the sixth proposed package of European Union sanctions against Russia over its invasion of Ukraine, according to reports. Kabaeva, who was born in 1983, was first linked to Putin more than a decade ago, while she was a gymnast. Putin has denied a relationship with her.

11.title: I didn't ask anyone out: Musk on claims of Sky Ferreira rejecting a date with him
11.article_body: Responding to a tweet that claimed model Sky Ferreira declined a date with him at the Met Gala when asked by his team, Elon Musk said, "I didn't ask anyone out". Musk tweeted he didn't request any particular seating on a picture of him seated with Ferreria at the event. He added, "This rumour originated from a parody account."

12.title: India would be 'silly' not to use Umran Malik straight away: Pietersen
12.article_body: Ex-England captain Kevin Pietersen said India would be "silly" not to use SRH pacer Umran Malik straight away, adding that he has been a "breakout" star of IPL 2022. "If I was an India selector, I would pencil him in for that Test match against England in July," stated Pietersen. Umran has picked 15 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

13.title: Would've been better if openers had flopped: Sehwag on GT's loss vs MI
13.article_body: Reacting to GT's loss against MI by five runs, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "I was thinking that had GT openers flopped, it would have been better. Usually when they flop, GT end up winning." "Hardik Pandya and Rahul Tewatia threw away a match that should have been won," added Sehwag. GT openers Wriddhiman Saha and Shubman Gill scored half-centuries.

14.title: Musk aims to increase Twitter's revenue to $26.4 bn by 2028: Report
14.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk is aiming to increase Twitter's annual revenue to $26.4 billion by 2028, up from $5 billion last year, the New York Times reported citing a pitch deck by Musk to investors. Advertising will reportedly fall to 45% of total revenue under Musk, down from about 90% in 2020, generating $12 billion in revenue in 2028.

15.title: Price of 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder increased by ₹50
15.article_body: The price of 14.2-kg domestic LPG cylinder has been increased by ₹50 with effect from today. The domestic cylinder will now cost ₹999.50. Earlier this month, the price of a 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by ₹102.50. In April, the price of 19-kg commercial LPG cylinder was increased by ₹250.

16.title: Female Afghan teachers who lost jobs after Taliban takeover to be reinstated
16.article_body: All female teachers who lost their jobs after the Taliban took over Afghanistan in August 2021 will be reinstated in Nimroz province, the province's Education Department said. The reappointment of 196 teachers "may occur soon", Nimroz Education Department Director, Mawlawi Yar Mohammad Haqyar, told Tolo News. This comes as Taliban government faces criticism for closing secondary schools for girls.

17.title: 4-year-old girl dies after iron gate falls on her in Palghar
17.article_body: A four-year-old girl died after a dismantled iron gate fell on her at the Vasai civic pond in Palghar on Thursday. The girl was rushed to hospital but she was declared dead. According to reports, the civic contractor had dismantled all four iron gates of the pond precinct, but they were kept near the entrance amid renovation work.

18.title: Bombay HC declares Powai cycle and jogging track illegal
18.article_body: The Bombay High Court has ruled that BMC's project of construction of a bicycle and jogging track at Powai Lake and the catchment area is "illegal" and directed the civic body to restore all the reclaimed land. "The corporation is directed to remove all the construction which has been carried out by reclaiming land," the court said.

19.title: 7 people charred to death as fire breaks out in 2-storey building in Indore
19.article_body: At least seven people were charred to death after a fire broke out in a two-storey building in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, Police Commissioner Harinarayana Chari Mishra said. Nine people have been rescued so far, he added. "The fire might have started through a short circuit. It took us three hours to bring the fire under control," a fire official said.

20.title: David Warner partied a lot, had a fight so we sent him back: Sehwag on IPL 2009
20.article_body: Recalling David Warner's first year in IPL in 2009, the then Delhi Daredevils captain Virender Sehwag revealed that the Australian cricketer used to party a lot. "He partied more than believing in practice or playing matches. He had a fight with a few players...so we sent him back," Sehwag added. He stated that he wanted to teach Warner a lesson.

21.title: Airtel broadband suffers outage in parts of Delhi, Bengaluru & other cities
21.article_body: Several users took to Twitter after Airtel broadband services suffered a major outage in parts of Delhi and nearby cities on Friday night. While Airtel is yet to issue an official statement on this, reports say the services were also hit in Mumbai, Bengaluru, Jaipur and Hyderabad. According to website outage monitoring platform DownDetector.com, the outage affected millions of users.

22.title: Man tags Gadkari, says B'luru traffic police 'harass' people; police denies
22.article_body: A man on Friday tagged Union Minister Nitin Gadkari in a tweet and claimed that the traffic police in Bengaluru are harassing the citizens by "clicking pictures and filing cases as per their choice". The traffic police replied to the man's claim, saying that Digitab violations are "proof-based" and there's "no chance of filing a case as per their choice".

23.title: Pune has best environment to become an automobile hub: Gadkari
23.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari on Friday said that Pune has the "best environment" to become an automobile hub as major manufacturing units are situated in the district. He added that he will also take up the issue of completion of the airport in Purandar. Gadkari was inspecting start-up products at an event organised by Science and Technology Park, Pune.

24.title: Delhi government to allow bars to serve liquor till 3 am
24.article_body: Delhi government has taken a policy decision to allow bars to serve liquor till 3 am to make the nightlife more happening, officials said. An order is likely to be issued soon in accordance with the Excise Policy 2021-22, an official added. "Excise Department will work with other agencies...if the timing is extended till 3 am," the official added.

25.title: Mumbai railway reservation services to remain shut for few hours on May 8-9
25.article_body: Mumbai Passenger Reservation System (PRS) will be shut for maintenance for over 4.5 hours between 11:45 pm on May 8 and 4:15 am on May 9. Current reservations, refund counters and coaching refund terminals will not be operating during this time due to the shutdown. Internet booking for Mumbai PRS trains will also not be available during this period.

26.title: Massive explosion at 5-star hotel in Havana kills 22, injures 60
26.article_body: At least 22 people have died and more than 60 have been injured after a massive explosion hit a five-star hotel in Cuba's Havana. Cuba's President Miguel Diaz-Canel said, "It was not a bomb or an attack, it's an unfortunate accident." He further said that the blast at Hotel Saratoga appeared to have been caused by a gas leak.

27.title: Musk denies Trump 'encouraged' him to buy Twitter, says 'had no communication'
27.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk took to Twitter to react to a report that quoted Truth Social CEO Devin Nunes who said that Donald Trump had "encouraged" Musk to buy Twitter. Musk tweeted, "This is false. I’ve had no communication, directly or indirectly, with Trump, who has publicly stated that he will be exclusively on Truth Social."

28.title: Political vendetta of Kejriwal, Punjab CM: Sidhu on Bagga's arrest
28.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Friday criticised AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann over BJP leader Tajinder Bagga's arrest. Taking to Twitter, Sidhu said that Kejriwal and Mann's "political vendetta...to settle personal scores through the Punjab Police is a cardinal sin". He further asked them to stop "tarnishing" the Punjab Police's image by politicising it.

29.title: Today there's a 'king' instead of CM in Telangana: Rahul Gandhi
29.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday criticised CM K Chandrashekar Rao-led Telangana government, saying that people thought a government for the poor will be formed but "today there's a king instead of a CM". Addressing the Raithu Sangharshana Sabha in Warangal, he stated that if Congress forms government in Telangana, farm loans of up to ₹2 lakh will be waived.

30.title: Bihar jail superintendent's office & house raided, ₹11 lakh seized
30.article_body: Bihar Police's Special Vigilance Unit (SVU) teams on Friday found around ₹11 lakh cash in raids on the office and residence of Saharsa district jail superintendent Suresh Choudhary. The raids were conducted in connection with a disproportionate assets case. An FIR was registered by the vigilance police station in Patna, an SVU official said.

31.title: MI hand GT their 2nd loss in a row as Daniel Sams defends 9 runs in last over
31.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) defeated Gujarat Titans (GT) by five runs to register their second win in a row in IPL 2022. MI pacer Daniel Sams defended nine runs in the last over as GT suffered their second straight defeat in the tournament. Ishan Kishan top-scored for MI with 45(29), while MI's Murugan Ashwin took two wickets in the match.

32.title: Kerala has become breeding centre for Islamic terrorism: BJP chief
32.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda, while addressing a rally in Kerala on Friday, said the state had become a "breeding centre for Islamic terrorism" under the CPI(M)-led government's rule. He added that "(the LDF) poses to be neutral but...it's encouraging Islamic terrorism." He further alleged that religious communities, especially Christians, were concerned about the "fast demographic changes".

33.title: These are mere threats: Jharkhand CM criticises BJP after ED raids
33.article_body: After the Enforcement Directorate (ED) conducted raids at multiple premises, including that of Jharkhand Mining Secretary Pooja Singhal, Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren criticised the BJP saying "these are mere threats". "They've lost their status of being the biggest party in the state and are backlashing for it," Soren said. Anyone breaking the country's laws will face consequences, he added.

34.title: Procedure was not followed: Haryana CM on Tajinder Bagga's arrest
34.article_body: Condemning BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest by the Punjab Police, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said the "procedure was not followed" while arresting him from his residence in Delhi. "Political issues don't unfold like this. But forcing Punjab Police to pick up a political figure in this manner...there should at least be a little amiability," ML Khattar said.

35.title: 20-yr-old woman gang-raped by 4 men including 2 minors in MP
35.article_body: Police said that a 20-year-old woman was abducted and gang-raped by four men including two minors in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar, adding that two of the accused have been arrested. The woman was returning home with her brother-in-law when the accused thrashed him and abducted the woman, the police added. Another accused and a minor are absconding, the police said.

36.title: Leopard skin seized by Odisha Crime Branch STF, 1 arrested
36.article_body: Odisha Crime Branch's Special Task Force (STF) arrested a person and seized one leopard skin from his possession in the Balangir district. The accused has been identified as Adikand Gheewala, a press release stated. Since he did not have documents to support the possession of leopard skin, he was reportedly handed over to Bolangir Forest Officials for legal action.

37.title: India's COVID-19 death numbers quite a bit lower than rich countries: Bill Gates
37.article_body: India's COVID-19 death numbers are "quite a bit lower than rich countries", Microsoft Co-founder Bill Gates said in an interview with Times Now. He, however, admitted that there is "some debate over what those numbers are". On being asked how he would rate India's COVID-19 response on a scale of 1-10, Gates said, "I'll give India seven or eight."

38.title: Nobody is tough, anybody is beatable: Sindhu on picking her hardest opponent
38.article_body: On picking her toughest opponent, two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu said, "I feel nobody is tough and at the same time, anybody is beatable." She added, "Right now everybody is of the same standards...you've to give your 100%, no matter what." Sindhu has won Syed Modi India International, Swiss Open and Badminton Asia Championships bronze medal in 2022 so far.

39.title: 18 Chinese military aircraft enter Taiwan's air defence zone
39.article_body: Taiwan on Friday said that 18 Chinese military aircraft entered its air defence zone. It is the second-largest one-day incursion by Chinese military aircraft this year, according to AFP. Taiwan is currently in a heighten state of alert due to fears China could use Russia's invasion of Ukraine to make a similar military move on the island, according to Reuters.

40.title: Sri Lanka declares state of emergency from midnight
40.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa has declared a state of emergency from midnight. The move will give security forces sweeping powers for the second time in five weeks amid escalating anti-government protests. A spokesman said the President invoked the tough laws to "ensure public order" after trade unions staged nationwide strike demanding his resignation over a worsening economic crisis.

41.title: Sourav Ganguly hosts Amit Shah for dinner at his Kolkata residence
41.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly hosted Union Home Minister Amit Shah for dinner at his Kolkata residence on Friday. Shah was accompanied by a number of BJP workers including West Bengal Leader of Opposition Suvendu Adhikari for the dinner. Shah also addressed a function at the Victoria Memorial to commemorate the 75th year of India's Independence.

42.title: Ranveer Singh celebrates Rohit Sharma's six at IPL match, MI share pic
42.article_body: Ranveer Singh jumped with joy and punched in the air as he celebrated Mumbai Indians captain Rohit Sharma's six at the Indian Premier League (IPL) match against Gujarat Titans (GT). In a clip, Ranveer is seen shouting as he raised his hands to celebrate the six. Sharing Ranveer's picture, MI tweeted, "RS on the pitch & RS in the stand!"

43.title: 'He began to cry, hadn't eaten lunch for a year': Coach on MI's Kartikeya's struggle
43.article_body: Recalling MI spinner Kumar Kartikeya's struggle, his coach Sanjay Bharadwaj revealed that he offered the youngster to share on-site accommodation he had for his academy's cook. Recalling the first day Kartikeya stayed at his academy in Delhi, Sanjay said, "When the cook gave him lunch, Kartikeya began to cry, he hadn't eaten lunch for a year."

44.title: MI's Tilak has talent, temperament to play for winning team: Dasgupta
44.article_body: Praising Tilak Varma for his batting in ongoing IPL, Deep Dasgupta said the 19-year-old MI batter has been consistent in his debut IPL season. "His strike rates have been terrific in most matches. Tilak certainly has the talent and temperament to play for a winning team," he added. With 328 runs from 10 matches, Tilak is the leading-scorer for MI.

45.title: Witch-hunt of BJP workers continues in Bengal: Dharmendra Pradhan
45.article_body: Condemning West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee over the death of Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha (BJYM) worker Arjun Chowrasia, Union Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan said, "Witch-hunt of BJP [workers] continues unabated in Mamata Didi's Bengal." Arjun Chowrasia's death is a "grim reminder of the pitfall of democratic ethos and law and order situation in West Bengal", Pradhan tweeted.

46.title: 8 killed, 30 injured in explosion at hotel in Cuba
46.article_body: At least eight people were killed and 30 others were injured in an explosion that damaged a hotel in Cuba's Havana on Friday. Speaking at the scene, Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel ruled out a bomb blast and said initial investigations suggested that the explosion was caused by a gas leak. Some people were reported to be missing after the explosion.

47.title: Ganguly's wife Dona performs classical dance at event attended by Amit Shah
47.article_body: BCCI President Sourav Ganguly's wife Dona Ganguly performed classical dance at an event attended by Home Minister Amit Shah at Kolkata's Victoria Memorial. A video of the performance was shared by a Culture Ministry official on Twitter. The event was held to celebrate the inscription of Durga Puja in the representative list of Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity by UNESCO.

48.title: Top seed Djokovic beats Hurkacz to enter semis at Madrid Open
48.article_body: Top seed Novak Djokovic beat 12th seed Hubert Hurkacz 6-3, 6-4 in the quarterfinal at Madrid Open 2022 on Friday. "(I'll be) more relaxed because I won today, but one thing is sure: tomorrow I'll face a Spanish rival," said Djokovic. The three-time champion will face world number nine Carlos Alcaraz, who beat Rafael Nadal 6-2, 1-6, 6-3, in semi-final.

49.title: Tajinder Bagga's arrest was as per the procedure: Mohali DSP Sandhu
49.article_body: After BJP condemned Punjab Police for the arrest of its leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, Mohali DSP KS Sandhu said that Bagga was apprehended "as per the procedure". "Punjab Police followed...procedure in taking...Bagga into custody," Sandhu said. Notably, Delhi Police registered a case of kidnapping after Bagga's arrest by Punjab Police over his alleged threat to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal.

50.title: US sanctions digital currency mixing firm for aiding N Korea
50.article_body: The US on Friday announced it has imposed sanctions on digital currency mixing firm Blender.io for aiding North Korea to launder stolen virtual currency and support cyber crimes. Notably, it's the first time sanctions were imposed on a digital asset mixing service. Blender.io is accused of helping a North Korean hacking group carry out a $620 million digital currency heist.

51.title: No plans to split auto business into 3 units: M&M denies restructuring reports
51.article_body: Mahindra and Mahindra (M&M) has denied reports claiming it has initiated a restructuring process to split its automobile business into three units. "There are no plans to split the auto business of the company into 3 units," M&M said on Friday. Earlier, reports said M&M is considering splitting up into an electric vehicle, a tractor and a passenger vehicle business.

52.title: It was a great ride: Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari on returning to Earth
52.article_body: Indian-American astronaut Raja Chari was among the four astronauts aboard a Space X spacecraft which on Friday safely splashed down in the Gulf of Mexico after spending nearly six months at ISS. "Glad to be back...It was a great ride," he said after the splashdown. The commander of SpaceX Crew-3 mission to space, astronaut Raja Chari joined NASA in 2017.

53.title: AAP misusing Punjab Police to target opposition: Sukhbir Badal
53.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal condemned the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) over BJP leader Tajinder Bagga's arrest and said the party was "misusing" Punjab Police to target the opposition parties. Sukhbir Badal also said that the AAP government was formed in Punjab based on "fake promises". "Punjab DGP should take responsibility for this matter," Badal added.

54.title: 44-year-old woman killed following suspected rape bid in Odisha
54.article_body: A 44-year-old woman, whose body was found in a field in Odisha's Balangir on Wednesday, may have been murdered for resisting rape, police said. The police found alcohol bottles during their search and believe that the suspects were consuming alcohol in the field when the woman arrived there. They then allegedly attempted to rape her and killed her for resisting.

55.title: MP farmer dies after live wire falls on him while working in field
55.article_body: A 45-year-old farmer died after a live electric cable fell on his head while he was working in his field in Madhya Pradesh's Dewas district on Friday. The farmer was going to start a submersible pump on his farmland at the time of the incident. He was rushed to the hospital by his neighbours but later succumbed during treatment.

56.title: Over 150 fall ill after eating dinner at engagement function in MP
56.article_body: Over 150 people, who had dinner at an engagement function in a village in Madhya Pradesh's Betul district on Thursday fell ill due to suspected food poisoning. Two of them are in critical condition and have been admitted to the district hospital. The Food Department has collected samples of the dishes served at the function for testing.

57.title: Record deforestation reported in Brazil's Amazon in April
57.article_body: Deforestation in Brazil's Amazon surged to record levels in April, preliminary government data showed on Friday. As compared to deforestation data from April last year, the area cleared of forest nearly doubled this year. Notably, deforestation in the Amazon has soared since President Jair Bolsonaro took office in 2019 and weakened environmental protection.

58.title: Use of loudspeakers in mosques is not a fundamental right: Allahabad HC
58.article_body: The use of loudspeakers in mosques is "not a fundamental right", the Allahabad High Court has ruled. It said this while dismissing a petition filed by a man who sought permission to play Azaan using loudspeakers in a mosque. "Azaan is an integral part of Islam, but giving it through loudspeakers is not a part of Islam," it added.

59.title: Batting at no. 4 for GT is bringing best out of Hardik in IPL: Rajput
59.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Lalchand Rajput has said the responsibility of batting at number four for GT is bringing the best out of skipper Hardik Pandya in ongoing IPL. "He used to bat in the lower batting positions for MI, but now...he can change his game to take responsibility and finish as well," he added. Hardik has so far scored 309 runs.

60.title: Won't be able to play Tests if I don't play in T20 Blast properly: Archer
60.article_body: Talking about his comeback after a long injury lay-off, England pacer Jofra Archer said if he doesn't play properly in the upcoming T20 Blast for Sussex Sharks, then he won't be able to play Test cricket. The 27-year-old underwent two elbow surgeries last year. He last played for England against India during T20I series in Ahmedabad in March 2021.

61.title: Will topple TRS govt in upcoming Assembly polls in Telangana: Rahul
61.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Friday said that in the upcoming Assembly elections in Telangana, the Congress party will topple CM K Chandrashekar Rao-led government and form its own government in the state. He further said, "The person who has ruined the dream of Telangana and stolen lakhs and crores from the youth, poor, we will not forgive them."

62.title: 4 of a family set themselves on fire in Andhra Pradesh, 2 dead
62.article_body: Police said that four members of a family in Andhra Pradesh's Srikakulam attempted self-immolation, leaving a woman and her daughter dead. The woman's other daughter and son sustained burn injuries, police added. She decided to take the step as she was unhappy with her mother-in-law for allegedly refusing to give her share in the property, Sub-Inspector Pari Naidu said.

63.title: ‘Space jellyfish' phenomenon witnessed in US sky after SpaceX rocket launch; pic viral
63.article_body: Several people are sharing pictures and videos of 'space jellyfish' phenomenon witnessed in the sky in US' Florida after SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket launch. SpaceX has launched 53 internet satellites, Starlink. The space jellyfish phenomenon occurs when a rocket lifts off in the hours around dawn or dusk and is caused by sunlight reflecting off high altitude rocket plume gases.

64.title: Zelenskyy calls on German Chancellor to visit Ukraine on May 9
64.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has invited Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz and President Frank-Walter Steinmeier to visit Kyiv on May 9, the date when Russia commemorates the Soviet Union's victory in World War II. Zelenskyy said that Scholz's visit will be a "very powerful political step". Notably, German Parliament President Bärbel Bas is scheduled to visit Ukraine on Sunday.

65.title: Can't believe people took Salman's 'I'm virgin' comment seriously: Karan
65.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar in an interview has said he can't believe people took actor Salman Khan's 'I am a virgin' comment seriously. Salman had said he is saving himself for his future wife during his appearance on 'Koffee with Karan' in 2013. "That is what is scary as you can say anything and people might take you seriously," Karan added.

66.title: PFI is very dangerous, it aims to destabilise India: TN Governor
66.article_body: Calling the Popular Front of India (PFI) a "very dangerous organisation", Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi said that the organisation aims to "destabilise this country from within". "There are political parties that are supporting them for their own political vested interest," RN Ravi said. "It is a threat we need to be very careful about," he added.

67.title: ED raids premises of Jharkhand mining secretary, others; ₹17 crore recovered
67.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Friday raided multiple locations, including the premises of Jharkhand Mines and Geology Department Secretary Pooja Singhal and businessman Amit Agarwal in Ranchi, in connection with a money-laundering probe. Cash worth at least ₹17 crore was recovered from a Ranchi-based chartered accountant's premises, officials said, adding that banknote counters were brought in.

68.title: Actress Chhavi Mittal pens note for husband after breast surgery
68.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal on Friday took to Instagram to pen a note for her husband Mohit Hussein after her breast cancer surgery. She wrote, "Noone can love me as much as you do! You never snap... you are patient with me." She further wrote, "Its too too painful right now (to raise my right arm), but I'll get there soon!"

69.title: Centre should bring a policy on loudspeakers: Maha Home Minister
69.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil said that the Centre should come out with a policy for the entire country on the use of loudspeakers. He thanked people from both Hindu and Muslim communities for cooperating with the state government to maintain peace amid the issue. His comment comes after Raj Thackeray demanded the removal of loudspeakers from Maharashtra's mosques.

70.title: Dead shark found hanging in a high school in US; pic surfaces
70.article_body: A dead shark was found hanging from the rafters in a high school campus in US' Florida. The Florida Fish and Wildlife Conservation Commission (FWCC) said that the act was carried out by five students of the school as a part of a prank and is further investigating the incident. The school staff removed the shark.

71.title: Johnny Depp and Amber Heard come face-to-face in court, video goes viral
71.article_body: A video showing Amber Heard and Johnny Depp making eye contact and coming face-to-face during their court trial has been widely shared online. In the clip, the judge is heard announcing a break after which the two actors get up to leave and almost run into each other. Amber is seen stopping suddenly after making eye contact with Depp.

72.title: I'm legally blind in one eye, mom abused me because of it: Depp
72.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp, amid his ongoing defamation trial against ex-wife actress Amber Heard, has revealed that he is legally blind in one eye. He further said that he was verbally, psychologically and physically abused by his mother because of it. Depp accused her of using terms like "cock eye, one eye, anything she could get to demean and humiliate" him.

73.title: Bollywood needs to focus more on story & script: Yami Gautam
73.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam has stated that the Hindi film industry needs to focus more on the story and script in films, adding that it needs to straighten its priorities. "My husband (director) Aditya (Dhar)...even after three years of (Uri's) release is working on one of his most ambitious films...There were just two or three who understood (his vision)," she added.

74.title: Reliance Industries becomes 1st Indian firm to hit $100 billion revenue in a year
74.article_body: Reliance Industries on Friday reported a net profit of ₹60,705 crore on a gross revenue of ₹7.92 lakh crore ($102 billion) for the full fiscal 2021-22, making it the first Indian company to hit $100-billion revenue mark. "Despite the ongoing challenges of the pandemic and heightened geo-political uncertainties, Reliance has delivered a robust performance," its Chairman Mukesh Ambani said.

75.title: Largest white diamond ever auctioned, 'The Rock', expected to sell for up to $30 mn
75.article_body: The largest white diamond ever auctioned will go under the hammer in Geneva next week, part of a sale by Christie's that features two stones. 'The Rock', a 228.31 carat pear-shaped stone roughly the size of a golf ball, is expected to sell for up to $30 million, it said. Christie's is also selling a 205.07 carat yellow, cushion-shaped stone.

76.title: Ben Stokes records most sixes in a first-class innings in England
76.article_body: Durham all-rounder Ben Stokes has set the record for smashing the most number of sixes in a first-class innings in England. The 30-year-old England Test captain slammed 17 sixes during his knock of 161 runs off 88 deliveries against Worcestershire. He overtook Andrew Symonds and Graham Napier, who had slammed 16 sixes each in a first-class innings in England.

77.title: It's good: AFI President Sumariwalla on postponement of 2022 Asian Games
77.article_body: Reacting to the postponement of 2022 Asian Games in Hangzhou, Athletics Federation of India (AFI) President Adille Sumariwalla said it's good. He stated that it would have been difficult for the athletes to "peak" continuously at World Athletics Championships (July 15-24), Commonwealth Games (July 28-August 8) and then Asian Games. The Games have been postponed amid COVID-19 surge in China.

78.title: Tunisia's Jabeur becomes 1st Arab woman to reach WTA 1000 final in Madrid
78.article_body: Tunisia's Ons Jabeur became the first Arab player to reach a WTA 1000 final after defeating qualifier Ekaterina Alexandrova 6-2, 6-3 in semi-final at Madrid Open on Thursday. "I'm very happy with the level I played with today," she added. The eighth-seed will play American Jessica Pegula, who beat Swiss Jil Teichmann 6-3, 6-4. It's Jabeur's second final of 2022.

79.title: MP CM Chouhan's wife shares 30-year-old pic on wedding anniversary
79.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan's wife Sadhna Chouhan on Thursday shared a 30-year-old picture to mark their 30th wedding anniversary. Taking to Twitter, she said that the "journey" from 1992 to 2022 with her "life partner" passed by quickly, adding, "Thank you for all the best wishes." The couple got married on May 6, 1992.

80.title: Students dance to 'Pushpa' song in Odisha classroom, principal suspended
80.article_body: The headmistress of a high school in Odisha's Ganjam was suspended after a video showing students dancing in a classroom to a song from Telugu film 'Pushpa: The Rise' surfaced on social media, District Education Officer Binita Senapati said. "Some students who were present in the classroom might have linked the TV with their mobile phones," Senapati added.

81.title: Poonam Dhillon shares pics with Big B, Shahi to mark 44yrs in B'wood
81.article_body: Veteran actress Poonam Dhillon on Friday shared pictures with Amitabh Bachchan, Shashi Kapoor and Randhir Kapoor among others to mark 44 years in Bollywood. She wrote, "My first Film released...when I was about 16...never it will be my career ,which I will grow to love so dearly!" She further wrote, "I have done Films, TV, Theater and now OTT."

82.title: BJP workers protest outside AAP office in Delhi after Bagga's arrest
82.article_body: BJP workers on Friday protested outside AAP's Delhi office over the arrest of party leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga. BJP's Adesh Gupta said Bagga was arrested for "unmasking" Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal's lies. "It's said that if you want to see someone's real face, give that person power...The real character and face of Kejriwal has...come to the fore," he added.

83.title: Reliance Industries' net profit rises 22.4% year-on-year to ₹16,203 crore in Q4
83.article_body: Billionaire Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries on Friday reported a 22.4% year-on-year rise in its consolidated net profit for Q4 2022 at ₹16,203 crore. The company's revenue from operations rose 36.79% to ₹2,11,887 crore, compared with ₹1,54,896 crore in the corresponding quarter last year. Reliance further said that its board has recommended an annual dividend of ₹8 per equity share.

84.title: 326 sedition cases filed during PM Modi's first term: Congress
84.article_body: The Maharashtra unit of Congress on Friday said that 326 sedition cases were filed during PM Narendra Modi's first term from 2014 to 2019. "There is no data after 2019," it added. "A total of 149 cases of sedition have been filed for speaking against Narendra Modi and 144 for speaking against (UP CM) Yogi Adityanath," it claimed.

85.title: 19-year-old thief escapes from Punjab Police's custody
85.article_body: A 19-year-old man, arrested for allegedly stealing electric items and ₹1.6 lakh cash from his workplace in Punjab's Chandigarh, escaped from police custody on Thursday. A police team had taken the accused, Rahul Kumar, to a semi-hilly area in Gurgaon's Manesar for the recovery of stolen cash. "Rahul cleverly jumped from a small hill and managed to escape," police said.

86.title: 6 killed, 7 hurt as container truck hits 3-wheeler in Maharashtra
86.article_body: At least six people, including two students and two women, were killed and seven others were injured after a speeding container truck collided with a three-wheeler in Maharashtra's Ahmednagar district on Friday. The incident occurred around 8 am near Masudpur Phata under the jurisdiction of Kopargaon city police station, an official said. The truck driver has been arrested, police added.

87.title: Indian actors have made huge inroads in H'wood, doing great work: Tabu
87.article_body: Actress Tabu has stated that Indian actors have made huge inroads in Hollywood and are doing their great share of work. She further said that women across the globe are given interesting characters to play nowadays "which was really big 20 years back". "Be it the industry on OTT or TV...Now it is almost like a prerequisite," the actress added.

88.title: NASA releases audio representing 'sound' of a black hole
88.article_body: American space agency NASA has released audio linked to a black hole at the centre of the Perseus galaxy cluster. The audio was created by the translation of data into sound and was released as a part of NASA's Black Hole Week. The black hole sound waves were scaled up by 57 and 58 octaves to make them audible.

89.title: Donkey remains a donkey: Imran Khan as he describes his life in UK in viral clip
89.article_body: A video clip of former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's recent podcast, wherein he described his life in the UK, has gone viral online. "I felt very welcomed in the UK, but I never considered it my home...A donkey doesn't turn into a zebra just because you paint stripes on it. A donkey remains a donkey," Khan said.

90.title: Delhi reports 1,656 new COVID-19 cases in 24 hours, positivity rate at 5.39%
90.article_body: Delhi on Friday reported 1,656 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, as compared to 1,365 cases recorded on Thursday. The national capital also saw 1,306 recoveries and zero deaths in the last 24 hours. The city witnessed a slight dip in the daily positivity rate, which stood at 5.39% on Friday, compared to 6.35% on Thursday.

91.title: Dutch envoy deletes 'shouldn't have abstained on Ukraine' tweet after Indian envoy's reply
91.article_body: The Netherlands' envoy Karel van Oosterom has deleted his tweet to India's Permanent Representative to the UN Ambassador TS Tirumurti that stated, "You should not have abstained in the GA (UN General Assembly). Respect the UN Charter." This came after Tirumurti responded to him by saying, "Kindly don't patronize us Ambassador. We know what to do."

92.title: 18 students injured, 30 miss Class 10 board exam as van overturns in Punjab
92.article_body: Eighteen children sustained injuries after an overloaded van carrying 30 students overturned in Punjab's Faridkot district on Friday morning, police said. The students were headed to an examination centre to write their Class 10 board examination, but missed it due to the accident, police added. According to the police, the small van carrying the students was meant for transporting goods.

93.title: 21-year-old woman shot dead by brother in Pak for choosing dancing, modelling as career
93.article_body: A 21-year-old woman has allegedly been shot dead by her brother for pursuing dancing and modelling as  career in Pakistan. The woman named Sidra was modelling for a local clothing brand and danced in theatres against the wishes of her family, according to police. She had come home from Faisalabad to celebrate Eid with her family last week.

94.title: Constitute COVID commission, pay ₹4L compensation: Cong after WHO report
94.article_body: Congress on Friday demanded the constitution of a COVID-19 commission and compensation of ₹4 lakh each to the families of those who lost their lives due to COVID-19. This comes after a World Health Organization's report claimed that there were 47 lakh COVID-19-related deaths in India in 2020-2021. The figure is nearly 10 times that of the government's official figures.

95.title: Man arrested after 113 complaints of harassment filed by women in UP
95.article_body: A man has been arrested on charges of teasing, blackmailing and stalking girls and women in Uttar Pradesh's Kaushambi. The arrest was made after 113 such complaints were received against him by 1090 Women Power Line from 36 districts over a period of time. "He had been warned several times, but he continued with his activities," a police officer said.

96.title: India expects to seal FTA with EU by next year: Piyush Goyal
96.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal on Friday said that India will be able to conclude a Free Trade Agreement (FTA) with the European Union (EU) by next year. India is also negotiating FTAs with the UK, Canada and Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC), he added. The FTAs will push growth in India and create more jobs as well, he further said.

97.title: Cocaine worth $11 billion sold in Europe in 2020: EU report
97.article_body: Cocaine worth over $11 billion was sold in Europe in 2020, according to a joint EU report by law enforcement agency Europol and drugs agency EMCDDA. Europe is increasingly becoming a hub for production and trans-shipment of cocaine to other regions of the world, the report said. Notably, the sales were recorded amid restrictions on movements due to the pandemic.

98.title: Pat Cummins shares pic of pav bhaji, says 'How had I never tried it before!'
98.article_body: KKR's Australian fast bowler Pat Cummins took to Twitter and asked his followers in Mumbai about what local dish he should try. Cummins then shared a picture of pav bhaji he ordered. After a fan asked him his feedback, Cummins replied, "Wow, I’ve been coming to India for 11 years how had I never tried it before!?! Delicious."

99.title: 3 TN policemen booked for murder in custodial death case: CM Stalin
99.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday said three police personnel, who were initially suspended over the killing of 25-year-old Vignesh allegedly in police custody, have been booked for murder. Vignesh's autopsy report shows he had suffered 13 injuries, including some on his face. "We demand the CM to shift the case to CBI," Leader of Opposition EK Palaniswami said.

100.title: Tewatia struggles when batting early, unsure over attack or defence: Sehwag
100.article_body: Sharing his opinion on GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said, "If he walks in early like he did in GT's last game against PBKS, he is unsure whether to attack or defend." "If Shubman Gill bats for the first seven to eight overs, then big-hitters like Tewatia and David Miller come into the game," added Sehwag.

101.title: Table-toppers GT to bowl first against bottom-placed MI, playing XIs announced
101.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl first against Mumbai Indians (MI) in their IPL 2022 clash on Friday. GT are fielding an unchanged side, while Murugan Ashwin has replaced Hrithik Shokeen in MI's playing XI. GT are currently on top of the points table, while MI are placed last.

102.title: Always feels great to perform well for team: Khaleel on his 3/30 vs SRH
102.article_body: ​​Speaking about his bowling performance in DC's 21-run win against SRH in IPL 2022, DC pacer Khaleel Ahmed said it always feels great to perform well for the team. He added that it's even better when that performance helps the team win. The 24-year-old pacer, who posted bowling figures of 4-0-30-3, was the leading wicket-taker in the match.

103.title: Their campaign for IPL 2022 is over: RP Singh on MI's 8 losses in 9 games
103.article_body: Following MI's eight losses from nine matches in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer RP Singh said MI's campaign for the season is over. "They now need to look forward and start building the team for...next two to three years," he added. He further said that in the remaining league matches MI can test the bench they picked at the mega auction.

104.title: I always say that Nadal has 1000 lives, jokes world no. 9 Alcaraz
104.article_body: Speaking about compatriot Rafael Nadal, world number nine Carlos Alcaraz jokingly said, "I always say that he has 1000 lives, I mean he's dying and he survives in every match, every tough match for him." The 19-year-old Spaniard will face Nadal in the quarterfinals at Madrid Open 2022 on Friday. "I'll try to manage the pressure, the nerves," added Alcaraz.

105.title: Even I was under the impression that Hindi is the national language: Jaaved Jaaferi
105.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi, while speaking about the national language debate, said, "I read up a bit about it...I was looking at the official Indian languages and the constitution gives no language a status of the national language." "I was even under the impression that Hindi is the national language," he added. "The point is about unity in diversity," said Jaaved.

106.title: 8-yr-old boy's handwritten note on losing grandmother, dogs, home shared by Ukraine govt
106.article_body: Ukrainian Minister Dmytro Kuleba has shared a handwritten note of an eight-year-old boy, Yehor, stating that it was found in his diary while he was "hiding from Russian bombs" in Mariupol. "Since February 24, my two dogs have died, and my grandma Halya, and my beloved Mariupol," Kuleba translated the note. Kuleba added that boy's grandfather also died.

107.title: Reliance Jio Q4 net profit rises 24% to ₹4,173 cr, revenue hits ₹20,901 cr
107.article_body: Reliance Jio Infocomm, the telecom unit of Reliance Industries, on Friday reported a standalone net profit of ₹4,173 crore for the quarter ended March 31, up 24.2% from ₹3,360 crore during the same quarter in the previous year. The company's revenue for the fourth quarter of the financial year rose from ₹17,358 crore in March 2021 quarter to ₹20,901 crore.

108.title: Pune university, 950 affiliated colleges to start road safety cell at campus
108.article_body: To create road safety awareness at a young age, Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU), along with Pune RTO, will start a road safety cell at the university campus and at 950 SPPU-affiliated colleges in Pune, Nashik and Ahmednagar. "It is necessary to train the students in road safety and make them responsible road users," SPPU's Vice-Chancellor Nitin R Karmalkar said.

109.title: FTII students' association opposes Anurag Thakur's visit to Pune campus
109.article_body: The students' association of Pune's Film and Television Institute of India had opposed the visit of Information and Broadcasting Minister Anurag Thakur to the campus on Thursday. Issuing a statement opposing his visit, they asked "what the presence of Thakur means to this place (campus)". "The impact of...Anurag Thakur's beliefs and proclamations of the recent past are condemned," they added.

110.title: Ben Stokes smashes 8 sixes in 10 balls in county match
110.article_body: Durham all-rounder Ben Stokes smashed eight sixes in 10 balls on Day 2 of his team's County Championship Division Two 2022 match against Worcestershire. The eight sixes included his five maximums in a row in an over bowled by spinner Josh Baker. Stokes reached his hundred off 64 deliveries. He scored 147*(82) before lunch was called on Day 2.

111.title: Work underway to prevent waterlogging at Delhi's Pul Prahladpur underpass
111.article_body: The Public Works Department (PWD) in Delhi is constructing an underground reservoir, with a capacity of 7.5 lakh litres, at the Pul Prahladpur underpass to prevent waterlogging during monsoon. The department is also constructing a permanent pump house of 600 horsepower to remove the accumulated water during the season. Last year, a man had drowned at the underpass during monsoon.

112.title: Man opens plane's emergency door & walks onto its wing in US, arrested
112.article_body: A 57-year-old man was arrested in the US after he opened the emergency exit door of the United Airlines flight he was travelling in and walked out onto its wing. The incident took place on Thursday when the plane was taxiing at Chicago's O'Hare International Airport. After walking out, the man slid down the plane's wing and onto the airfield.

113.title: It is atrocious: Camila Cabello on scrapping abortion in US
113.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello has said that the US Supreme Court overturning basic abortion rights is atrocious, adding that it's going to affect poor women the most. "The idea of having one moment transform the course of a woman's life is tragic. And it's tragic the people affected are not having a say," the singer added.

114.title: 30 Gurugram liquor shops without fire safety nod to be issued notices
114.article_body: Gurugram fire department will issue notices to about 30 liquor shops' owners and their warehouses across the city, which don't have a valid fire NOC, officials said. These shops will reportedly have to procure a NOC from the department, otherwise, legal action will be initiated against them. This comes days after a massive fire gutted a liquor shop in Gurugram.

115.title: Over 30 students punch, kick each other after father confronts son's bullies in US
115.article_body: A fight broke out between more than 30 students at a school in US' Arizona allegedly after a student's father, Willie Smith, confronted his son's bullies. A video of the incident has gone viral on social media, showing Smith and students kicking and punching each other as security officers try to stop them. At least two people have been arrested.

116.title: One of oldest-surviving Hizbul terrorists, 2 others killed in encounter in J&K
116.article_body: Security forces on Friday gunned down Ashraf Molvi, one of the oldest-surviving terrorists of Hizbul Mujahideen, along with two other militants in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Anantnag, police said. The encounter took place near the route of the annual Amarnath Yatra. Ashraf was included in the list of wanted terrorists and had been active in Kashmir since 2013.

117.title: 28 kg marijuana & 225 gm brown sugar seized in Hyd, 4 arrested
117.article_body: Hyderabad Police said that they seized 28 kg of marijuana and 225 gms of brown sugar from an interstate drug ring. Hyderabad Police Commissioner CV Anand conducted a press meet where he said that four drug peddlers were arrested in the case. This comes a day after the Cyberabad Police recovered over 104 kgs of marijuana.

118.title: Which are the top 5 fastest deliveries in IPL history?
118.article_body: Shaun Tait had bowled the fastest delivery in IPL while representing RR against DC in an IPL 2011 match. He had clocked 157.3kmph, as per ESPNcricinfo. SRH's Umran Malik on Thursday bowled the second-fastest (157kmph) and the fourth-fastest (155.6kmph) deliveries in IPL. DC's Anrich Nortje has bowled the third-fastest (156.2kmph) and fifth-fastest (155.2kmph) deliveries in IPL.

119.title: Man acquitted of murder after 13 yrs in jail in MP, state told to pay him ₹42 lakh
119.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh High Court has set aside the conviction of an ex-MBBS student who was jailed in 2008 after being accused of killing his girlfriend. Criticising the police for "falsely implicating" the man, the High Court also directed the state government to pay ₹42 lakh to him. "The case reveals a sordid saga of manipulative, preconceived investigation," it said.

120.title: L&T lnfotech CEO quits citing personal reasons as Mindtree merger announced
120.article_body: Larsen & Toubro lnfotech on Friday said that its CEO and Managing Director Sanjay Jalona has resigned from his position due to personal reasons. The development comes after L&T lnfotech announced its board has approved its merger with Mindtree. "Jalona has done a lot for the company and we are proud of him," Larsen & Toubro CEO SN Subrahmanyan said.

121.title: Russia will not use nuclear weapons in Ukraine: Foreign Ministry
121.article_body: The Russian Foreign Ministry on Friday said that Russia will not use nuclear weapons in Ukraine. Notably, the Russian Foreign Minister had earlier said that the West shouldn't underestimate elevated risks of nuclear conflict over Ukraine. On April 14, CIA Director William Burns had said that Russia may resort to use of potential "tactical nuclear weapons or low-yield nuclear weapons".

122.title: Shah Rukh Khan hosts diplomats at Mannat, pictures shared online
122.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan hosted diplomats, including the Consul General of Canada, France and others in Mumbai at his home Mannat. Canada's Consul General in Mumbai Diedrah Kelly shared pictures and tweeted, "I look forward to further strengthen ties...between Bollywood and the Canadian Film Industry." Jean-Marc Sere-Charlet, Consul General of France in Mumbai, also tweeted a picture with Shah Rukh.

123.title: People know our work: Bihar CM on Prashant Kishor's criticism of his govt
123.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Friday criticised political strategist Prashant Kishor for saying that the last 30 years under Lalu Prasad Yadav and Nitish Kumar had left Bihar as the most backward and poor state in the country. "Someone's opinion is not important," Kumar said. The CM added that people of the state know the work his government has done.

124.title: No COVID-19 death has gone uncounted in Delhi: Satyendar Jain
124.article_body: Delhi Health Minister Satyendar Jain said no COVID-19 death in Delhi has gone uncounted. This comes a day after the World Health Organisation estimated that there were 47 lakh COVID-19 related deaths in India. "Delhi is the capital city of the country and is it possible that someone dies of COVID-19 here and doesn't get a death certificate?" Jain questioned.

125.title: Hyderabad Police conduct raids on 2 hookah parlours, 15 arrested
125.article_body: Hyderabad Police's Central Zone Team conducted raids on two hookah parlours in the city named The Dark 'O' Cafe and Snax Cafe. Fifteen people were arrested during the raids, Hyderabad Police tweeted. A press release stated that these hookah parlours were violating the rules under COTP Act and were charging higher prices for hookah pots.

126.title: Nearly 25 mn tonnes of grain stuck in Ukraine amid war: UN
126.article_body: UN food agency said nearly 25 million tonnes of grain are stuck in Ukraine and unable to leave the country because of infrastructure challenges and blockade of ports amid war. The blockages are responsible for high food prices, it added. Ukraine was the world's fourth-largest exporter of corn and sixth-largest exporter of wheat in 2020/21, International Grains Council data showed.

127.title: Delhi govt to develop a model park in every district: Gopal Rai
127.article_body: Delhi Environment Minister Gopal Rai on Thursday chaired a meeting over the redevelopment of around 16,828 parks in the city. The minister said that under a pilot project, Delhi government will develop a park in every district in the national capital into a model park. The model parks will have amenities like pergolas, fountains, jogging tracks, open-air gyms and WiFi.

128.title: Anurag Basu trying to develop a two-hero script for Aamir, Ranbir: Report
128.article_body: Filmmaker Anurag Basu is trying to develop a two-hero script for Aamir Khan and Ranbir Kapoor, according to a report. "While the basic idea has been conceptualised by Aamir Khan Productions, Basu...has come on board to weave a screenplay," the report stated. "If everything falls in right place, the film will take off sometime next year," the report further said.

129.title: Surprised MI dropped Brevis but glad they went back to David vs RR: Pollock
129.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Shaun Pollock said he was "surprised" but glad at MI's decision to replace  Dewald Brevis with Tim David against RR in IPL 2022. "You spend money...then give the guy [David] just two opportunities," he added. David scored an unbeaten nine-ball 20 in MI's five-wicket win over RR. Brevis has scored 124 runs in six matches so far.

130.title: Diagnostics platform Redcliffe Lifetech raises $61 million
130.article_body: Redcliffe Lifetech has raised $61 million led by LeapFrog Investments. HealthQuad, Schroders, LC Nueva, Spark Growth Ventures and existing investors Chiratae Ventures and Alkemi Venture Partners also participated in the funding round. Redcliffe delivers diagnostics services in 22 state-of-the-art labs across 14 cities. It raised $10 million in its Series A funding round last year.

131.title: 'Rambo' is very different from everything that I've done before: Tiger
131.article_body: Tiger Shroff, in a recent interview, opened up about his upcoming project 'Rambo' which is the Hindi adaptation of the 1982 Hollywood classic of the same name featuring Sylvester Stallone. "It's going to be very different from everything that I've done before," he said. According to reports, Tiger will start shooting for the film by the end of this year.

132.title: WHO data, Cong 'beta' both wrong: BJP on Rahul's remarks on COVID deaths
132.article_body: BJP on Friday reacted to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's criticism of Centre over the WHO's claim that India reported the highest number of COVID-related deaths. BJP's Sambit Patra said, "India has...robust mechanism for birth and death registration. WHO's data and...Congress' beta are wrong." WHO had claimed that India had 47 lakh COVID-related deaths, which's nearly 10 times the official figures.

133.title: Didn't try scoring anything but a single: Vettori on Kohli's 30 (33) vs CSK
133.article_body: Reacting to Virat Kohli's 30 off 33 balls in RCB's win against CSK by 13 runs, ex-RCB captain Daniel Vettori said, "At no stage did Kohli look like he was going for anything but a single." "Maybe the...run-out of Glenn Maxwell...put him back in his cage," added Vettori. Kohli has a strike rate of 111.91 in IPL 2022 currently.

134.title: Kohli was set to break Tendulkar's record but now bad form at peak: Latif
134.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Rashid Latif has claimed that Virat Kohli was "set to break" Sachin Tendulkar's record of 100 international centuries before the former's "bad form" arrived. "The way Kohli used to perform...(he) was set to break Tendulkar's record with ease...He took it to the extreme. But now when he is dealing with bad form...that too has peaked," Latif said.

135.title: McCullum likely to become England's next white-ball coach: Reports
135.article_body: Former New Zealand skipper Brendon McCullum is reportedly the frontrunner in becoming  England's next white-ball coach. According to reports in the Daily Mail, McCullum has been "added to their (ECB) wishlist" along with former Proteas batter Gary Kirsten who is likely to become England's red-ball coach. Notably, the appointments were due after the axing of former head coach Chris Silverwood.

136.title: Private schools in Bengal asked to switch to online classes from May 7 amid heatwave
136.article_body: The West Bengal government has asked all private schools in the state to stop offline classes and switch to online classes from May 7, in view of the ongoing heatwave, an official said. "Private schools should not take any unilateral decision against the statement of Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on this issue," state School Education Department's Principal Secretary said.

137.title: Siraj is easily excitable, unable to plan as per the situation: WV Raman
137.article_body: Ex-India cricketer WV Raman said RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj is "easily excitable" and not experienced enough to plan what needs to be done as per the situation. "Siraj's ears will...hear a lot of things. He is trying to prove a lot of things to a lot of people," added Raman. Siraj has picked eight wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

138.title: Vaquita porpoise, with population of 10, could avoid extinction: Study
138.article_body: The world's smallest marine mammal, vaquita porpoise, has a chance of survival, despite numbering only about 10 in the wild. Genetic analysis by a team of UCLA biologists and colleagues has found that the species remains relatively healthy and can potentially survive if illegal "gillnet" fishing ceases promptly. "Vaquita is not doomed to extinction by genetics," UCLA's Christopher Kyriazis said.

139.title: Plea challenging Delhi University's offline exams dismissed by HC
139.article_body: The Delhi High Court quashed the plea which challenged the University of Delhi's February notice seeking the semester exams of all subjects in offline mode in May-June 2022. "This is not the right time to pass any order. However, the Court has given the liberty to petitioners to approach the court again," said Justice Rekha Palli while giving the judgement.

140.title: Nationwide strike in Sri Lanka demanding government to resign
140.article_body: Thousands of schools, factories, and businesses closed on Friday as public and private sector workers in Sri Lanka took part in a nationwide strike demanding President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's government's resignation over the worsening economic crisis. "We can pinpoint the policy blunders of the President that led to this very sorry state of our economy," trade union leader Ravi Kumudesh said.

141.title: I fail to understand why B'wood actors avoid doing guest appearances: Ajay
141.article_body: Ajay Devgn, who made guest appearances in 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and 'RRR', has said that he fails to understand why actors in Bollywood avoid doing guest roles, adding that Hollywood actors are always ready to make guest appearances in films. "According to me, small roles can outshine lead roles at times. So, why shouldn't I do such roles," Ajay further said.

142.title: Hardik can be picked purely as a bowler by any team in world: GT's Solanki
142.article_body: Gujarat Titans' Director of Cricket Vikram Solanki said the team's captain Hardik Pandya can be picked by any team in the world purely as a bowler. "Hardik is an exceptional cricketer with exceptional leadership qualities," added Vikram. Hardik has picked four wickets in nine IPL 2022 matches so far at an economy rate of 7.56 and bowling average of 35.

143.title: Who is Priyanka Mohite, the first Indian woman to scale 5 peaks above 8,000 metres?
143.article_body: Priyanka Mohite, who became the first Indian woman to scale five peaks above 8,000 metres after climbing Mount Kanchenjunga on Thursday, hails from Maharashtra's Satara. The 30-year-old is a postgraduate in biotechnology from Mumbai University and works as a research associate in Bengaluru. She's a recipient of Tenzing Norgay National Adventure Award 2020. She had scaled Mount Everest in 2013.

144.title: Ukraine starts fresh effort to evacuate civilians from Mariupol plant
144.article_body: A fresh attempt to evacuate scores of civilians trapped in the steel plant in Mariupol is underway, a senior Ukrainian official said on Friday. "Information about the results will be provided later," the official added. Notably, UN-brokered evacuations of some of the hundreds of civilians who had taken shelter in the plant were halted amid renewed fighting.

145.title: BJP's Tajinder Bagga tried to spread communal tension in Punjab: AAP
145.article_body: Hours after BJP leader Tajinder Bagga was arrested, AAP spokesperson Saurabh Bharadwaj said, "Through...his tweet, Bagga tried to spread communal tension and incite communal violence in Punjab." He claimed, "[Bagga's] USP is to speak dirty, poisonous...language...he makes two communities fight." Bharadwaj added, "BJP leaders in Delhi are trying to spread communal violence in Punjab."

146.title: Russian soldiers threaten to send heads of husbands in a box to Ukrainian women
146.article_body: Ukrainian women escaping from Mariupol have said that Russian soldiers threatened to murder their partners and send them their heads in a box. "Women who had acquaintances serving in the Ukrainian military or the police were threatened...They were promised that they would be sent their husband's head in a box," a woman said. She also said that they were strip-searched.

147.title: Had to call police: SRK's lookalike recalls getting mobbed during KKR match
147.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's lookalike Ibrahim Qadri, speaking to Humans of Bombay, recalled getting mobbed at a stadium during an IPL match between KKR and Gujarat Lions. "I got swamped and someone held onto me so tight that my t-shirt tore! It got so bad that I'd to call police...And after rescuing me, cops asked, 'SRK sir, ek selfie?'," he said.

148.title: They're self-made talents: Ranveer praises 'Jayeshbhai...' co-star, director
148.article_body: Ranveer Singh, in a recent interview, praised his 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' co-star Shalini Pandey and director Divyang Thakkar. "These are self-made talents that were...waiting to explode," he said, adding, "I'm...fortunate that I'm in...position to facilitate and empower that." Ranveer further said that he wants to give a platform to talented people with no godfathers to make a name in the industry.

149.title: BJP seeks CBI probe after worker's body found hanging in Kolkata; Shah visits his family
149.article_body: The BJP has demanded a CBI inquiry into the death of party worker Arjun Chowrasia, whose body was found hanging in Kolkata, Home Minister Amit Shah said. BJP said it has cancelled all celebrations scheduled to welcome Shah to Kolkata in light of the incident. Shah, who said he met the grieving family, claimed the deceased's grandmother was also beaten.

150.title: Was asked to pay ₹2,500 crore to become K'taka CM: BJP MLA; Cong demands probe
150.article_body: BJP MLA BR Patil (Yatnal) on Friday claimed he was asked to pay ₹2,500 crore to become the CM of Karnataka. "Don't believe these thieves who come making offers like they will get you a ticket, make you meet Sonia Gandhi or JP Nadda," Yatnal added, while addressing a party event. Congress' DK Shivakumar demanded a probe into Yatnal's allegations.

151.title: We have ads on condoms, why not film? Rakul on 'Chhatriwali'
151.article_body: Actress Rakul Preet Singh, speaking about her upcoming film 'Chhatriwali', said the conversation around the use of condoms must be destigmatised. The actress added, "We have ads on protection so why not a film? That was the thought." Rakul will play a small-town girl who happens to stumble upon the job of the quality control head of a condom factory.

152.title: Thane man arrested for verbally abusing policeman on duty, biting him
152.article_body: A 30-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly verbally abusing and biting a policeman in Thane. According to police, the accused allegedly went up to the police jeep and banged his head on the windscreen and damaged it. The incident took place when a police team heard music being played in the Naupada area during patrolling and went to investigate.

153.title: 70-yr-old Pune man molests, rapes 3-yr-old girl residing in his building; arrested
153.article_body: A 70-year-old man was arrested for molesting and raping a three-year-old girl residing in his building in Pune. Police said the accused and the girl didn't know each other. "He lured the girl into his home and forced himself on her," a sub-inspector said. The girl narrated her ordeal to her mother when the latter found her without clothes.

154.title: Concerned about protecting people from COVID: Nitish on Shah's CAA remark
154.article_body: Reacting to Union Home Minister Amit Shah's CAA remark, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar said, "It will be the decision of the Centre...coronavirus is still rising." "We are concerned regarding safeguarding the people from COVID," he added. Addressing a public rally in West Bengal, Amit Shah had said that Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends.

155.title: Climate change could spark next pandemic: Study
155.article_body: According to new study, the rising global temperature would lead to relocation of wild animals to areas with large human populations, thereby increasing the possibility of viral jump that could cause the next pandemic. The study stated that several mammals would encounter each other for the first time during such relocations called geographic range shifts and share thousands of viruses.

156.title: China builds permanent COVID testing stations for life after lockdown
156.article_body: China is setting up thousands of permanent PCR testing stations as authorities seek to "normalise" tough COVID-19 pandemic controls even after the current lockdowns end. According to officials, the stations will allow people to get tested in 15 minutes. Reportedly, the new system will make it a requirement for people to have a negative PCR test before entering public spaces.

157.title: Our career page has seen 8 lakh visits since WFH announcement: Airbnb
157.article_body: Airbnb CEO Brian Chesky has said the firm's career page has been visited 8,00,000 times since it said it would have the option for employees to permanently work remotely. "The response internally was great, but even more impressive [was] the response externally," Chesky said. Airbnb said employees could move to anywhere in a country without a reduction in their compensation.

158.title: Power supply to over 3,200 slum dwellers cut off in Mumbai's Chembur
158.article_body: The power supply to over 3,200 slum dwellers was cut off in Mumbai's Chembur on Friday morning over non-payment of dues since 2005. The electricity dues have accrued to over ₹102 crore, a spokesperson for Adani Electricity said. "These defaulting consumers...are creating hindrance when our staff and partners visit door to door for collecting dues," the spokesperson added.

159.title: L&T Infotech announces merger with Mindtree
159.article_body: Larsen & Toubro Infotech (L&T Infotech) on Friday announced that its board has approved a scheme of amalgamation and arrangement with Mindtree. Under the scheme, L&T Infotech will issue 73 shares for every 100 shares of Mindtree. After the completion of the merger, Larsen & Toubro Limited will hold a 68.73% stake in 'LTIMindtree', the combined entity.

160.title: Musk told investors he could double their money if they backed Twitter deal: Report
160.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk told investors that he was highly confident he could double or triple their money if they backed his $44 billion buyout of Twitter, as per a report. He reportedly also said he could double Twitter's users to over 500 million by 2025. Musk is said to temporarily serve as Twitter CEO after the deal is closed.

161.title: Even I was under the impression that Hindi is the national language: Jaaved Jaaferi
161.article_body: While speaking on the national language debate, Jaaved Jaaferi said that he was also under the impression that Hindi is India's national language. "But I...looked up that the Constitution gives no language the status of a national language," he added. "There are so many religions but there's no national religion...You have a national bird or a national flower," said Jaaved.

162.title: 'We were under pressure', says Kane Williamson after loss to DC
162.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad skipper Kane Williamson admitted after their 21-run loss to the Delhi Capitals on Thursday that their side was "under pressure". "For us, it's just going back to the drawing board...We were put under pressure a lot in that first half and allowed them (DC) to get an above-par total," Williamson said.

163.title: One of the best innings for Delhi franchise: Pant on Warner's 92*(58)
163.article_body: After Delhi Capitals' opening batter David Warner scored 92*(58) against SunRisers Hyderabad on Thursday, skipper Rishabh Pant said that the Australian's knock was one of the "best" he has ever seen for the Delhi-based franchise. "The way he (Warner) batted, the way he paced the innings, it's one of the best innings I have seen," Pant said.

164.title: Mamata wants zero-opposition: Agnimitra Paul on BJP worker's death
164.article_body: West Bengal BJP's General Secretary Agnimitra Paul blamed TMC for the death of BJP worker Arjun Chowrasia in Kolkata and said that the murder of BJP worker is not a new thing and TMC would remove anyone who speaks against them. "One year after the elections when the Home Minister is coming, our worker has been murdered," Paul added.

165.title: Arvind Kejriwal is misusing his power: Bagga's mother on his arrest
165.article_body: The mother of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, who was arrested by Punjab Police, has accused Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal of misusing his power. She said, "[Punjab Police] acted like 'hooligans', arrived in civil attire...took him away...They didn't even give time (to Bagga) to wear his turban." Bagga was arrested over his alleged threat to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal.

166.title: Man swallows jewellery worth ₹1.45 lakh along with biryani at Eid party in Chennai
166.article_body: A 32-year-old Chennai man allegedly swallowed jewellery worth ₹1.45 lakh before eating biryani at his fiancee's colleague's house during Eid party. Police said he confessed to swallowing the jewellery under the influence of alcohol, following which they took him to a hospital. He was reportedly given bananas and made to excrete the jewellery, which was handed over to the owner.

167.title: Malayalam actress Manju Warrier to star in Ajith Kumar's next: Report
167.article_body: Malayalam actress Manju Warrier has reportedly signed on to star opposite Ajith Kumar in his next film tentatively titled 'AK61'. According to reports, she will soon join the sets of the movie which is directed by H Vinoth and produced by Boney Kapoor. Notably, 'AK61' will be Manju Warrier's second Tamil film after Dhanush's 'Asuran'.

168.title: Reduce slavery to foreign goods, be vocal for local: PM Modi
168.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday urged citizens to reduce slavery to foreign goods and focus on the 'vocal for local' mantra. "Aatmanirbhar Bharat is our path as well as our resolve," Modi said while inaugurating the Jain International Trade Organisation's 'JITO Connect 2022' business meet. "We've to reduce dependence on foreign products. Find new destinations for export," he added.

169.title: Aus seeks 'strong friendship' with Solomon Islands despite China pact
169.article_body: Australian Defence Minister Peter Dutton said the country will continue having a "strong friendship" with the Solomon Islands despite it signing a security pact with China. Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare has been very clear that he isn't going to let China establish a military base on the islands and Australia is taking him at his word, Dutton added.

170.title: Govt orders all imported coal-based units to run at full capacity amid high demand
170.article_body: The government has invoked Section 11 of Electricity Act, mandating all imported coal-based power units to run at full capacity amid the ongoing power crisis in the country. "The demand for power has gone up by almost 20% in energy terms. The supply of domestic coal has increased but...it's not sufficient to meet increased demand for power," Power Ministry said.

171.title: 52-year-old Indian dies while trying to scale world's 3rd highest peak in Nepal
171.article_body: A 52-year-old Indian climber died near the summit of the world's third-highest peak Mount Kanchenjunga in Nepal on Thursday, the expedition's organisers have said. Narayanan Iyer breathed his last after collapsing at an altitude of 8,200 metres, they said. Two guides were assisting him in climbing, Pioneer Adventure's MD Nivesh Karki said.

172.title: Ram Charan's fans climb hotel walls to catch a glimpse of actor, video surfaces
172.article_body: Ram Charan was mobbed by fans upon his arrival in Visakhapatnam on Wednesday. A video of his fans climbing the walls of the hotel where the actor was staying to catch a glimpse of him has surfaced online. Charan reached Visakhapatnam to shoot for his upcoming project with Shankar. Tentatively titled 'RC 15', the film also stars Kiara Advani.

173.title: Adi Chopra turned floor of YRF into research wing: 'Prithviraj' director
173.article_body: The director of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj' Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi has stated that producer Aditya Chopra turned an entire floor of the Yash Raj Films office into a research wing for the film. "I had personally worked on the script from 2004 to 2019 updating...every year...We kept the research bay fully operational till the last day of the shoot," Chandraprakash said.

174.title: I try to unite whole India: Ayushmann on being pan-India face of legacy brands
