174.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana, speaking about being the pan-India face of legacy brands, stated that he has always tried to unite the whole of India through inclusive subjects and disruptive scripts and characters that challenge the status quo. "If I'm being viewed as someone who is contributing to sparking a dialogue...then I'm doing my job correctly," the actor said.

175.title: Person declared Indian once can't be declared foreigner later: Gauhati HC
175.article_body: A Foreigners' Tribunal bench of Gauhati High Court said that once the tribunal has declared a person to be an Indian, they cannot be declared a non-Indian if brought before it a second time. "A Foreigners' Tribunal only renders an opinion...it would be wrong to say that the Centre...would be bound by the opinion of the Tribunal," the court said.

176.title: Wristbands with caste identity not allowed in schools: TN's Theni District CEO
176.article_body: Chief Education Officer of Tamil Nadu's Theni ordered all school principals in the district to ensure coloured strings that indicate caste identity are not worn by the students. The order stated students will be severely punished if found inciting caste sectarianism. In April, a Tirunelveli student died after a clash with fellow students over wearing a wristband with caste identity.

177.title: Pune civic body may stop issuing new water connections: Official
177.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation plans to temporarily stop giving permission to new water connections to properties due to a water shortage, a PMC official said. "The...shortage...was expected due to...rising mercury levels and...expansion of city limits," the official added. "The situation would be reviewed by the end of this month and a final decision would be taken," the official further said.

178.title: Sonali repeats outfit she wore 16 yrs ago for an event with Pierce Brosnan, shares pics
178.article_body: Actress Sonali Bendre, in an Instagram post, revealed that for Huma Qureshi's Eid party, she wore an outfit she first wore 16 years ago for an event with 'James Bond' actor Pierce Brosnan. "I wore this 16 years ago, during my first trimester," she wrote while sharing pictures. "Super happy that in this regard not much has changed," Sonali added.

179.title: Hotel shut after snake skin found in its newspaper wrapped food in Kerala
179.article_body: A hotel in Kerala's Thiruvananthapuram has been temporarily shut after a customer allegedly found a part of a snake skin packed into her food. The snake skin was found in the newspaper that was used to pack the parottas, following which the food safety officials were alerted. The officials have also served a show-cause notice to the restaurant.

180.title: Pune man invests in fake forex trading firm, cheated of ₹21.66 lakh
180.article_body: A case has been filed after a 48-year-old man was cheated of ₹21.66 lakh by fraudsters who allegedly lured him into investing in a non-existent forex trading company, 'Tradeshotfx', in Pune. The complainant had come in contact with the accused through the internet and made the investments last year. The accused reportedly gave the complainant information showing profits he'd made.

181.title: Man seen duct-taped to plane seat in viral video jailed for groping crew's breasts in US
181.article_body: A passenger who was duct-taped to his seat for groping two flight attendants' breasts and punching one attendant mid-air has been jailed for 60 days in US' Ohio. A viral video of the incident showed the 23-year-old being bound to his seat on a Frontier Airlines flight. He was arrested by Miami Police after the plane landed.

182.title: Girl records video of father molesting her in Bihar to get him arrested; says 'he did it daily'
182.article_body: A girl has recorded a video of her father molesting her in Bihar's Samastipur to get him arrested. The girl, who said that her father allegedly "molested her daily", added that her mother held her responsible for the father's act. Police said that further investigation into the matter is underway.

183.title: Hardik would want to play at his best vs ex-team MI in IPL 2022: Gavaskar
183.article_body: Ahead of GT-MI in IPL 2022, Sunil Gavaskar said GT skipper Hardik Pandya would want to play at his best against MI as he wasn't retained by his ex-franchise in mega auction in February. "But he also owes so much to MI," he added. Gavaskar further said it won't be same as was the case for David Warner(92*) against SRH.

184.title: 2 dead after car hits motorbike in UP's Pratapgarh
184.article_body: Two people died while four others got injured after a car rammed into a motorbike in Uttar Pradesh's Pratapgarh on Friday. The two deceased, identified as Shailesh Kori (20) and Nirmala Devi (55), were going home on the bike when the accident took place, police said.  The car driver was allegedly under the influence of alcohol when detained, police said.

185.title: No ground for sedition against Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband Ravi Rana: Court
185.article_body: A court in Mumbai has said that there is no sufficient ground for invoking the charge of sedition against Maharashtra's Amravati MP Navneet Rana and her MLA-husband Ravi Rana. They have "undoubtedly crossed the line of freedom of speech", the court said. They were arrested after they announced to recite Hanuman Chalisa outside CM Uddhav Thackeray's private residence.

186.title: Fire breaks out at Calcutta High Court, no injuries reported
186.article_body: A minor fire broke out at a courtroom in Calcutta High Court around 10:45 am on Friday, police said. "Initially, there was a smell of burning electrical wires from the courtroom. It was evacuated immediately and the policemen posted there managed to douse the blaze," a police officer said. No injuries were reported in the incident.

187.title: Mrunal Thakur books 'Jersey' tickets for staff of coffee house in Mumbai
187.article_body: Mrunal Thakur recently visited a coffee house in Mumbai's Powai and booked tickets for her film 'Jersey' for the entire staff as a gesture for their hospitality. "The staff...was so sweet and generous in their hospitality and wished to see Jersey whenever they get time," the actress said, adding "It's incidents like these that...make me feel grateful."

188.title: Tomorrow's technology unveiled now with Ace EV: Tata Motors
188.article_body: Supported by the TATA UniEVerse and powered by the EVOGEN battery, the new Ace EV just got launched by Tata Motors. The company informed that the Ace EV is built for sustainable operations, reduced costs, and improved uptime through superior charging infrastructure, along with dedicated EV service and support centres.

189.title: B'luru sees rise in COVID containment zones as active cases cross 1,500
189.article_body: The number of containment zones in Bengaluru rose to nine on Thursday as active cases of coronavirus have crossed the 1,500-mark in the city. Mahadevpura has the most number of containment zones at four. The number of daily coronavirus cases recorded in Bengaluru Urban has increased in the past five days by nearly 83.9% to 171 on Thursday, data said.

190.title: WhatsApp working on feature to allow group admins to delete others' texts: Report
190.article_body: Meta owned WhatsApp is working on a new feature that will enable group admins to delete messages posted by other members on the group, as per a report. The move will reportedly enable admins to act as moderators of a group. Apart from this, WhatsApp is also working on extending the time to delete a message for everybody.

191.title: 398 kids rescued from Pune railway station, reunited with families
191.article_body: At least 398 children, who had run away from their homes, were rescued from the Pune railway station between April 2021 and March 2022, a report stated. Railways officials said that after counselling and help from the administration, the rescued children were reunited with their families and relatives. Out of the total children, 303 were boys, and 95 were girls.

192.title: 2 held in Punjab for alleged links with Khalistani terrorists
192.article_body: Two people were arrested from Punjab's Ferozepur and Faridkot districts for their alleged links with the four suspected Khalistani terrorists arrested on Thursday for carrying ammunition in Haryana's Karnal. The two suspects, identified as Akashdeep and Jashandeep, are accomplices of the four suspected terrorists linked to Pakistan-based Babbar Khalsa terrorist Harwinder Singh Rinda, police said.

193.title: Begged onlookers for help, no one came: Wife of man lynched by her relatives in Hyd
193.article_body: The Muslim wife of 25-year-old Hindu man Nagaraju who was allegedly lynched by her relatives on a busy road in Hyderabad said she had "begged and pleaded" onlookers for help. "The attack went on for 15-20 minutes, but no one helped," said Sulthana. "If the onlookers had helped, my husband would be alive today," she added.

194.title: Will Smith in therapy after Oscars slapping incident: Report
194.article_body: Actor Will Smith has been going to therapy after the 2022 Oscars slapping incident, reported Entertainment Tonight. The actor slapped comedian Chris Rock onstage after the latter made a joke about his wife Jada Pinkett Smith's alopecia. Will had later apologised for the incident in an Instagram post. He made his first public appearance at Mumbai airport on April 23.

195.title: EV-charging hub set up at B'luru mall, 50 cars can be charged at one time
195.article_body: Fortum Charge & Drive India has commissioned a public electric vehicle (EV)-charging hub at Forum Neighbourhood Mall in Bengaluru. According to the company, the charging hub will cater to all types of electric cars and compatible three-and two-wheelers and can charge 50 cars at one time. The company is planning to set up 200 EV charging points across the city.

196.title: 1971 war finest example of whole-of-govt approach towards national security: Rajnath
196.article_body: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the 1971 Indo-Pakistani war was the finest example of the whole-of-government approach not only for armed forces but also for national security. Speaking at PC Lal Memorial Lecture, he said, "It's not always necessary to have more expensive weapon systems. It is the employment of weapon systems that gives us an edge in wars."

197.title: He could've got 6 runs in another over: Yuvraj on declaration when Sachin was on 194*
197.article_body: Talking about Rahul Dravid declaring India's innings against Pakistan in 2004 Multan Test when Sachin Tendulkar was batting on 194*(348), Yuvraj Singh said, "We got a message...that we had to play fast and we were going to declare." "He could have got those six runs in another over...I don't think another two overs would've made a difference," Yuvraj added.

198.title: He said 'That's not how cricket is played': Powell on offering Warner chance to hit 100
198.article_body: DC's Rovman Powell revealed that before the start of last over against SRH, he asked David Warner if he wanted a single to try to get a hundred. "Warner said, 'Listen...that's not how cricket is played. You should try to smack it as hard as...possible'," Powell said. Powell scored 18 runs in last over, while Warner remained unbeaten on 92.

199.title: Xiaomi allowed to operate seized assets worth ₹5,551 crore by K'taka HC
199.article_body: Karnataka High Court has stayed the ED's decision to seize ₹5,551.27 crore from Xiaomi Technology India Private Limited's bank accounts for suspected violations of foreign exchange laws. The court has allowed Xiaomi to operate its seized accounts for day to day activities. The company earlier said its "royalty payments and statements to the bank are all legit and truthful".

200.title: Only 23 of India's 100 unicorn startups are profitable: Report
200.article_body: Only 23 of the 100 unicorns (startups with a valuation of $1 billion or above) in India have achieved profitability for a financial year, Moneycontrol reported citing data from Tracxn Technologies. These startups have raised over $80 billion from investors to date, it added. The list of profitable unicorn startups includes Zerodha, Nykaa, Zoho, Lenskart, CoinSwitch Kuber, Mamaearth and Shiprocket.

201.title: People ask ridiculous rapid-fire questions; what are we, teenagers? Radhika
201.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte has stated that people ask "some ridiculous questions" during rapid-fire question and answer rounds. She was giving an interview which included a rapid-fire round. The actress added that there are questions like choosing between this person or that person. "You can't choose from two actors you've worked with. What is this, what are we, teenagers?" she said.

202.title: Police officers help woman deliver baby at Prayagraj rly station
202.article_body: Two female police officers, who are part of the 'Operation Meri Saheli' team, helped a woman deliver her baby girl at the platform of a railway station in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. A public relations officer said that the woman was about to board a train when she started experiencing labour pains. The woman and her husband thanked the railway authorities.

203.title: Biden's daughter won't travel to Europe after COVID-19 contact
203.article_body: US President Joe Biden's daughter, Ashley Biden, will not travel to Europe with the First Lady after coming into contact with a coronavirus-infected person, the White House said. The 40-year-old has tested negative for COVID-19, it added. First Lady Jill Biden left the US on Thursday for Romania and Slovakia, where she'll highlight US commitment to Ukrainian refugees.

204.title: He called me sl*t, kicked me: Amber as she claims Depp accused her of affair with Franco
204.article_body: Amber Heard testified about an incident in which Johnny Depp allegedly slapped and kicked her on an airplane after accusing her of having an affair with James Franco. "He hated, hated James Franco...He called me a sl*t," she recalled. Members of Depp's security team and his assistants were on the plane, she said, adding that "no one said anything".

205.title: Over half of BSES consumers in Delhi got no power bill since 2019: Data
205.article_body: Over half of the BSES consumers in Delhi did not have to pay power bills since the implementation of Delhi government's scheme in 2019, that gives free power to those consuming less than 200 units of electricity per month, according to data. From 2021 to February this year, the percentage of consumers falling under the 200-unit slab was 52.8%.

206.title: You set high benchmark: Jet Airways' CEO as IndiGo congratulates it on test flight
206.article_body: After IndiGo congratulated Jet Airways on its test flight on Thursday, Jet Airways' CEO Sanjiv Kapoor thanked its competitor airline and said, "You guys have set the benchmark really high." He added, "[You've] shown what's achievable by an (Indian) airline...in terms of size, scale and consistency of operations with...focus on basics." Jet Airways is in the process of relaunching operations.

207.title: Always said yes to woman-centric films as tribute to my mother: Arjun Rampal
207.article_body: Actor Arjun Rampal revealed he has always said yes to any woman-centric film he has been approached with. "That's my way of giving tribute to my mother because I know how much strength she had," Arjun added. Notably, Arjun's upcoming film, 'Dhaakad', is also a woman-centric film wherein Kangana Ranaut will be seen playing the lead role.

208.title: Monkey fled with evidence: Rajasthan police to court hearing 2016 murder case
208.article_body: On being asked by a court to produce evidence in a 2016 murder case, the Rajasthan police said a monkey fled with it. They also blamed a constable for this, who was suspended and later retired and died. The bag containing the murder weapon and other evidence was reportedly kept under a tree as the police station had no space.

209.title: Man beaten to death for using loudspeaker at temple in Gujarat
209.article_body: A 40-year-old man died after he and his brother were allegedly beaten with sticks by members of their own community for using loudspeaker while performing aarti at a temple in Gujarat's Mehsana. The deceased's brother claimed that when they refused a person's request to stop using the loudspeaker, the latter and four others attacked them. The incident occurred on Wednesday.

210.title: Shashi Tharoor pens poem after man's 'Chochi airport, egg water' tweet goes viral
210.article_body: Congress leader Shashi Tharoor penned a poem after a man tweeted, "If you are in Chochi kindly be aware of airport lounge named Earth Lounge...they use egg water to bake...dosa." "In 'Chochi', an outraged young vegan. Reacted as if shot with a ray-gun. Hearing 'thanda' as 'anda'. He 'baked' a huge blunder. Should've stuck to chawal & baingan!" Tharoor wrote.

211.title: Reality check, have to use your mind: RP Singh on Umran's 52-run spell vs DC
211.article_body: Discussing SRH pacer Umran Malik's spell against DC where he conceded 52 runs without picking a wicket, ex-India pacer RP Singh said, "You [have]...pace...but you also need...use of the mind to go with that." "This was a massive reality check," added Singh. "Umran got a substantial drubbing," stated Singh. "[He] isn't properly prepared yet...and...[needs] to improve a lot," he said.

212.title: Major fire breaks out at chemical plant in Gujarat's Ankleshwar; 6 injured
212.article_body: At least six workers were injured after a massive fire broke out at the factory of chemical manufacturer United Phosphorus Limited (UPL) in Gujarat's Ankleshwar on Friday morning. Fire tenders were rushed to the spot soon after the fire officials received a distress call regarding the fire around 7 am. The injured persons were rushed to a nearby hospital.

213.title: Germany to supply Ukraine with 7 self-propelled howitzers
213.article_body: The German government on Friday said it will supply Ukraine with seven self-propelled howitzers, which reach a firing distance between 30 to 40 kilometres, amid its war with Russia. The training of Ukrainian troops on the artillery weapons could start next week in Germany, German Defence Minister Christine Lambrecht said. Earlier, the Dutch government had pledged five howitzers to Ukraine.

214.title: Tesla aims to run two shifts at Shanghai plant from May 16: Report
214.article_body: Tesla is aiming to run two shifts at its Shanghai plant from May 16, Reuters reported citing an internal memo. It plans to produce 2,600 electric cars from the Shanghai plant per day from then. Earlier, Tesla said it will turn Shanghai into "the world's largest vehicle export hub" with a new factory capable of producing 4,50,000 EVs per year.

215.title: Akshay lends his voice to trailer of Ganesh Acharya's 'Dehati Disco'
215.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has lent his voice to the trailer of Ganesh Acharya's upcoming film 'Dehati Disco'. "When he came to know that I am making a film based on dance, he wanted to support the film in every way," Ganesh Acharya said about Akshay. Directed by Manoj Sharma, the film features Ganesh Acharya and Ravi Kishan in key roles.

216.title: Started working on 'Laal...' 14 yrs ago, it has been quite a journey: Aamir
216.article_body: Aamir Khan, in his podcast titled 'Laal Singh Chaddha Ki Kahaniyaan', revealed that he started working on the movie 14 years ago. "In June-July, [it] will complete 14 years, since we started it. It has been quite a journey. First few years, we were running behind the rights," he said. It's a remake of the 1994 American film 'Forrest Gump'.

217.title: SpaceX 'Crew-3' led by Indian-American Raja Chari returns from ISS
217.article_body: SpaceX's Crew-3 led by Indian-American Raja Chari has returned after a six-month mission aboard ISS. The crew consisted of American spaceflight veteran Tom Marshburn, and three first-time astronauts, NASA's Raja Chari, Kayla Barron, and ESA's Matthias Maurer. Crew-3 returned to Earth with some 250 kilograms of cargo, including loads of ISS research samples.

218.title: Locals mistake lion printed bag as stray lion in Kenya, wildlife service shares pics
218.article_body: Locals in Meru County, located near Mt Kenya National Park, alerted the Kenya Wildlife Service about a stray lion hiding in the bushes after they mistook a supermarket bag with a lion's picture printed on it. The wildlife service tweeted pictures of the bag which contained avocado seedlings and praised the public for their alertness.

219.title: Downey Jr remembers assistant Jimmy on his death anniversary, shares old pics
219.article_body: Robert Downey Jr took to his Instagram handle on Thursday to remember his personal assistant Jimmy Rich on the latter's first death anniversary. He shared several candid photos and some video clips of Jimmy, writing, "For...1 year anniversary of Jimmy's cosmic mic drop, I felt...need to share a glimpse into his lightning wit, huge heart, and at times, profound simplicity."

220.title: Mumbai man molests 44-year-old British woman at Bandra club; held
220.article_body: Mumbai Police arrested a 35-year-old-man for allegedly molesting a 44-year-old British national at a club in Bandra on Tuesday. "When the woman went to the washroom, the...accused molested her...[she] then returned to her table and narrated the incident to her husband and friends, following which they ran towards the accused and caught hold of him," a police official said.

221.title: Who are the highest run-scorers and wicket-takers in IPL 2022 after 50 matches?
221.article_body: Following the conclusion of 50 matches in IPL 2022, RR opener Jos Buttler has scored the most runs in the tournament so far, with 588 runs. He's followed by LSG captain KL Rahul (451) and PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan (369). Meanwhile, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal is the highest wicket-taker with 19 scalps, followed by DC spinner Kuldeep Yadav (18 wickets).

222.title: Which states have fertility rate above replacement level as total rate falls to 2.0?
222.article_body: India's Total Fertility Rate, an average number of children per woman, has declined to 2.0. There are five states which are above replacement level of fertility of 2.1 - Bihar (2.98), Meghalaya (2.91), UP (2.35), Jharkhand (2.26) and Manipur (2.17). According to UN, countries experiencing below-replacement fertility, indicates that a generation is not producing enough children to replace itself.

223.title: Sonali repeats 16-yr-old outfit she wore for an event with Brosnan, shares pics
223.article_body: Sonali Bendre took to Instagram to share a picture of herself from Huma Qureshi's Eid party and revealed that she repeated the outfit that she wore 16 years ago at an event with 'James Bond' actor Pierce Brosnan. "Wore this 16 years ago, during my first trimester while carrying Ranveer Behl...Happy that in this regard not much has...changed," Sonali added.

224.title: J&K Congress calls delimitation panel report 'politically motivated'
224.article_body: J&K Congress on Thursday termed the report by Delimitation Commission as "biased", "faulty" and "politically motivated". "The commission has neglected fundamental principles...ignored the aspirations of people and did great injustice to different...communities," said J&K Congress chief spokesman Ravinder Sharma. As per the report, 43 assembly seats have been allotted to Jammu and 47 to Kashmir.

225.title: Such misuse of police never done in India's history: Mishra on Bagga's arrest
225.article_body: BJP leader Kapil Mishra on Friday reacted to party spokesperson Tajinder Bagga's arrest by Punjab Police, claiming that around 50 police officers had arrested him from his house. He also claimed that such "misuse" of police over a tweet has never been done in India's history. "[Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal] has become scared of a true sardar," he said.

226.title: Govt aims to boost coal output by 100 mn tonnes, reopen closed mines: Official
226.article_body: India is looking to boost its coal output by 75-100 million tonnes in the next two-to-three years by restarting closed mines, Coal Secretary Dr AK Jain said amid reports of power crisis in the country. Coal India, which produces 80% of India's coal, plans to increase annual output to one billion tonnes by 2024, from the current 622.6 million tonnes.

227.title: WB BJP worker's body found hanging in abandoned building ahead of Shah's visit
227.article_body: A West Bengal BJP worker's body was found hanging in an abandoned building near his home ahead of Union Home Minister Amit Shah's visit to Kolkata. The deceased, identified as Arjun Chowrasia, was a member of the BJP's youth wing. Notably, Chowrasia was scheduled to lead a bike rally in one of the events planned for Shah's welcome.

228.title: Revenge time, 2018 final loss was very sad: Salah on CL final vs Madrid
228.article_body: Liverpool forward Mohamed Salah said his team will look to get revenge against Real Madrid in their upcoming Champions League final, having been defeated 1-3 in the final of the tournament's 2018 edition. "It was a very sad day for...us," added Salah. Liverpool defeated Villarreal 5-2 on aggregate to enter their third Champions League final in five years.

229.title: It’d be atomic bomb on economy: Hungary rejects EU sanctions on Russia
229.article_body: Hungarian PM Viktor Orban said that his country wouldn't support the European Union's new sanctions package against Russia. The European Commission's current proposal banning Russian oil imports would amount to an "atomic bomb" dropped on the Hungarian economy, he added. However, Orban said Hungary was ready to negotiate if it sees a new proposal that would meet Hungarian interests.

230.title: Car jumps over divider, collides with mini-bus in B'luru; 2 dead
230.article_body: Two people, aged 22 and 18, were killed after the car they were in jumped over the divider, hit another car and then collided head-on with a mini-bus on Bengaluru's NICE Road on Thursday. One of the deceased, who was driving the car, reportedly lost control after a tyre burst while he was overspeeding. The mini-bus driver was injured.

231.title: Science doesn't lie, Modi does: Rahul Gandhi on WHO's COVID-19 deaths
231.article_body: A day after the World Health Organization (WHO) claimed that India reported highest death due to COVID-19, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi criticised the central government and said, "Science doesn't LIE. Modi does." Taking to Twitter, Rahul said, "47 lakh Indians died due to the Covid pandemic. NOT 4.8 lakh." "Support them with the mandated ₹4 lakh compensation," Rahul told Centre.

232.title: One of Nadal's big things is his aggression during matches: Andy Roddick
232.article_body: Talking about Rafael Nadal, former world number one Andy Roddick said, "One of Rafa's big things is he can get into...matches and the aggression will come, him opening up the shoulders and bullying people will come." "He looks like a guy that hasn't played a tournament in a while but you don't...worry about him on the clay," added Roddick.

233.title: Mumbai man takes life as recovery agents harass him for loan he never took
233.article_body: A 38-year-old man in Mumbai died by suicide after being reportedly harassed by recovery agents of an instant loan app for recovery of a loan. The agents allegedly threatened him to pay back the loan, although he repeatedly told them he hadn't taken any loan. They also sent his morphed nude photos to his colleagues and relatives before his death.

234.title: Ex-sarpanch shot at, attacked during fight at restaurant in Pune
234.article_body: A former sarpanch is undergoing treatment at a hospital after he was injured during a fight between two groups at a restaurant in Pune's Manjri. The main accused allegedly shot at the former sarpanch, hit him on the head with a brick and threatened to see who would intervene. The incident took place around 12.45 am on Wednesday.

235.title: Jamia researchers develop tool to decipher neurological disorders
235.article_body: An optogenetic tool has been developed by the researchers of Jamia Millia Islamia's Multidisciplinary Centre for Advanced Research and Studies (MCARS). Notably, the tool has the potential to assist in understanding various neurological disorders like Alzheimer's disease, schizophrenia and depression. The research has been done in collaboration with the US-based National Institutes of Health.

236.title: Lunar soil can be used to make oxygen & fuel on moon: Study
236.article_body: Scientists have found that the lunar soil brought back by China's Chang'e-5 spacecraft contains iron-rich and titanium-rich substances that could work as catalysts to convert carbon dioxide into oxygen and generate hydrocarbons like methane that can be used as fuel. The researchers are exploring if these resources can be used to support human life on the moon and in space.

237.title: Pics of blood-stained furniture, guitar, walls surface amid Depp and Heard's trial
237.article_body: During Johnny Depp's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard, the court was shown pictures of blood around house after an alleged fight between the two. Amber's team claimed the pictures were taken after Depp allegedly physically abused her in Australia in 2015.  The images showed blood on a sofa, white sheets and a guitar.

238.title: Asian Games 2022 postponed amid COVID-19 crisis in China
238.article_body: The Asian Games 2022, which were due to take place in China's Hangzhou in September, have been postponed indefinitely, organisers said. This comes as China is battling a new wave of COVID-19 driven by the Omicron variant. Notably, the host city of Hangzhou lies near Shanghai, which has endured a weeks-long lockdown as part of China's zero-tolerance approach to coronavirus.

239.title: Zomato CEO to donate ESOP proceeds for education of delivery agents' kids
239.article_body: Zomato's CEO Deepinder Goyal will be donating all his employee stock option plan (ESOP) proceeds worth ₹700 crore to Zomato Future Foundation (ZFF). ZFF will cover the education of up to two children of delivery agents of Zomato. This entails up to ₹50,000 cover per child annually for agents who have been with Zomato for more than five years.

240.title: UP govt to provide free WiFi at all 58,189 gram panchayat secretariats
240.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh government announced that it will soon provide free WiFi facilities in all its 58,000 gram panchayats. The facility would be provided within a 50-metre radius of village secretariats. The move to set up free WiFi would give a fillip to boost "economic activity", exploring the "hidden potential" of villages and the residents, the state government said.

241.title: 20-yr-old woman murdered inside home, jewellery stolen in Ghaziabad
241.article_body: A 20-year-old woman was allegedly strangled to death with a wire inside her home and jewellery was stolen by unidentified robbers in Ghaziabad, police said. The victim's 70-year-old mother-in-law was present in the house when the incident happened and was assaulted by the accused, police added. The family suspects involvement of daily wage labourers working in their house, police stated.

242.title: Delhi Police registers kidnapping case after BJP's Bagga arrested by Punjab Police
242.article_body: Delhi Police has registered a kidnapping case after arrest of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga by Punjab Police over his alleged threat to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal. Bagga was arrested from his Delhi residence. Punjab Police said it had intimated Janakpuri police station before arresting Bagga, who had failed to appear before the police, despite being served five notices.

243.title: Punjab Police dragged my son out of the house, punched me: BJP leader Bagga's father
243.article_body: The father of BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga, who was arrested by Punjab Police from his Delhi residence, has said, "10-15 police personnel came to our home and dragged Tajinder out." "When I picked up my mobile phone to record a video of the incident, police took me to another room and punched me in the face," he added.

244.title: Couple dies by suicide after poisoning their children in Chhattisgarh
244.article_body: A couple died allegedly by suicide after poisoning their two minor children in Chhattisgarh's Kanker, police said. The husband and wife were found hanging from the ceiling fan in a hotel room and their kids were found dead on the bed, police added. The incident came to light when a hotel employee knocked on the door and no one responded.

245.title: He is currently better than me: Rafael Nadal on Spain's Carlos Alcaraz
245.article_body: Rafael Nadal said fellow Spaniard Carlos Alcaraz is currently better than him, adding that it will be "very, very tough" to face him. "I am a very realistic person," stated Nadal. "Alcaraz is in a better physical state of mind [and] is more fit," said Nadal. Nadal will take on Alcaraz in the quarter-finals of the Madrid Open 2022.

246.title: Cyberabad Police arrests 4 drug peddlers with ganja worth ₹15 lakh
246.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Thursday arrested four drug peddlers and seized 104 kg of ganja worth ₹15 lakh from their possession. Acting on a tip-off, police intercepted a car at Mahadevapuram X Road and arrested the accused. They were reportedly transporting the contraband from Chinturu in Visakhapatnam to KPHB Colony. Two of the accused are farmers from Visakhapatnam, police said.

247.title: 'Pushpa' actors Allu Arjun, Rashmika to appear on Koffee with Karan: Report
247.article_body: 'Pushpa: The Rise' actors Allu Arjun and Rashmika Mandanna will reportedly appear together on the upcoming season of the talk show 'Koffee with Karan', hosted by filmmaker Karan Johar. "This season, 'Koffee with Karan' will witness a few big South celebrities, the makers have kept it well balanced to attract South audiences," Pinkvilla quoted a source as saying.

248.title: Journalist found dead in a bag in Mexico; 9th to be killed this year
248.article_body: A veteran Mexican journalist was found dead in the northwestern state of Sinaloa on Thursday, authorities said. Luis Enrique Ramirez was the ninth journalist to be killed in the country this year. Ramirez's body was reportedly discovered by security forces in a black bag and wrapped in plastic. Mexico is believed to be one of the "deadliest" countries for journalists.

249.title: Zomato shares hit an all-time low of ₹57.65; fall below issue price
249.article_body: Shares of Zomato dipped to an all-time low of ₹57.65 during intraday trade on Friday on BSE. While its issue price was ₹76, Zomato's stock price had touched an all-time high of ₹169.10 on November 16, 2021. Currently trading 66% below its all-time high price, Zomato shares have fallen over 57% on a year-to-date basis.

250.title: People want BJP's double engine govt in T'gana: BJP chief JP Nadda
250.article_body: Bharatiya Janata Party's (BJP) National President JP Nadda on Thursday said the people of Telangana want change in the state, adding, "They want BJP's double engine government." "KCR Ji has gone disturbed due to BJP winning in Dubbaka (bypoll in 2020) and Huzurabad (bypoll in 2021)," Nadda said while addressing the crowd at Mahabubnagar in Telangana.

251.title: Raj has loudspeaker issue now as brother Uddhav is Maha CM: Raut
251.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Thursday claimed that MNS chief Raj Thackeray never had any issue over loudspeakers before, but "he has this issue now because his brother (Uddhav Thackeray) is the CM of Maharashtra." Earlier, Raj had shared videos of the late Bal Thackeray speaking on the loudspeaker issue. "Politics is being done everywhere about loudspeakers," Raut added.

252.title: Struggled mentally, emotionally after returning from Australia: Djokovic
252.article_body: Talking about being deported from Australia in January having been unvaccinated against COVID-19, Novak Djokovic said, "This was something that was completely unexpected. So it did take a toll on me...mentally [and] emotionally." "It was the kind of circumstance or situation I had never faced in my life before," added Djokovic. "I felt I [was]...more nervous than usual," stated Djokovic.

253.title: Heard breaks down recalling Depp 'penetrating' her with bottle, says 'Couldn't breathe'
253.article_body: Actress Amber Heard broke down in the court while stating that her ex-husband, actor Johnny Depp, penetrated her with a vodka bottle after getting drunk in 2015 in Australia. She stated, "I've never been so scared in my...life...I couldn't breathe. I just remember thinking, 'Please God...please...I hope it's not broken.'" Heard was testifying in Depp's defamation trial against her.

254.title: Depp was in a relationship with a woman, went to her house just after marriage: Heard
254.article_body: Amber Heard has testified that Johnny Depp cheated on her with another woman just after the former couple got married. "He had gone to her house right after we got married, like upon touching down in Los Angeles, I think it was the next day he went to this woman's house, who he [had] a sexual relationship with," she said.

255.title: Karnataka govt gives nod for construction of Anubhava Mantapa
255.article_body: The Karnataka government has approved the project for the construction of Anubhava Mantapa in Basavakalyan, a significant site for the Lingayat community, located in Karnataka's Bidar district. The decision was taken in a Basavakalyan Development Board meeting chaired by CM Basavaraj Bommai. Notably, 12th-century reformer Basaveshwara tried to eradicate social inequities through Anubhava Mantapa.

256.title: Kedarnath Temple opens for devotees today, CM Dhami offers prayers
256.article_body: The doors of Uttarakhand's Kedarnath Temple, one of the country's 12 Jyotirlingas, were opened for pilgrims today. CM Pushkar Singh Dhami along with his wife Geeta Dhami offered prayers during the door opening occasion. On May 3, portals of Gangotri and Yamunotri temples were opened on Akshaya Tritiya, which also marked the start of the Char Dham Yatra 2022.

257.title: Rapper Post Malone expecting 1st child with long-time girlfriend
257.article_body: Rapper Austin Richard Post, professionally known as Post Malone, revealed in an interview that he's expecting his first child with his long-time girlfriend. He added that he's excited for this next chapter in his life. "I'm...happiest I've ever been, and for since I could remember I was sad," he said. The rapper hasn't disclosed the identity of his girlfriend yet.

258.title: We encouraged Musk to buy Twitter: Trump's Truth Social CEO
258.article_body: Former US President Donald Trump's venture Truth Social CEO Devin Nunes in an interview said, "We encouraged Elon Musk to buy it [Twitter] because someone has to continue to take on these tech tyrants." "President Trump, basically before Elon Musk bought it, actually said to go and buy it," Nunes added. Nunes expressed that Musk will create a "different" Twitter.

259.title: WhatsApp group warns K'taka Muslim women will be attacked for removing burqa
259.article_body: A WhatsApp group named 'Muslim Defense Force' has allegedly sent threatful messages to parents of Muslim women in Karnataka's Mangaluru, asking them to keep an eye on their children. "They are saying...Muslim women who wear a burqa in public places should not take it out to take photographs...or they will be attacked," police said, adding they are monitoring the situation.

260.title: Policeman arrested, suspended from duty for raping tribal woman in Raj
260.article_body: A 59-year-old Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) was arrested and suspended from duty for allegedly raping a 25-year-old tribal woman in Rajasthan's Jhalawar, police said. ASI was investigating a case that the rape victim had filed against her in-laws, police added. He called her on Monday, took her to a forest area on his motorcycle and allegedly raped her, police stated.

261.title: DiDi Prez, Lenovo founder go private on Chinese social media platform
261.article_body: The President of Chinese ride-hailing giant DiDi Chuxing Jean Liu and her father Liu Chuanzhi, the founder of Lenovo, have gone private on the Chinese social media platform Weibo. Earlier, both Jean and her father switched on a function on Weibo to hide all old posts. Neither had posted on the platform in the past six months.

262.title: Sensex falls over 1,000 points to trade below 55,000; Nifty slips below 16,400
262.article_body: The Sensex fell over 1,000 points to 54,668, while the NSE Nifty plunged 316 points to 16,366 during the intraday trade on Friday. Among the Sensex-30 shares, Bajaj Twins, Maruti, Wipro, Ultratech Cement, HCL Tech, Axis Bank, and Infosys were down up to 3%. Owing to weak global cues, the domestic markets had opened over 1.5% lower on Friday.

263.title: Daily COVID-19 cases in B'luru Urban rise by 83.9% to 171 in 5 days
263.article_body: The number of daily coronavirus cases recorded in Bengaluru Urban has increased in the past five days by nearly 83.9% to 171 on Thursday, according to Karnataka health department data. The number of daily cases reported in the city on May 1 was 93. Furthermore, the city has reported no deaths due to coronavirus in the past five days.

264.title: US is not providing Ukraine intel to kill Russian generals: Pentagon
264.article_body: The Pentagon has denied that the country had provided intelligence on the locations of Russian generals on the battlefield so that Ukrainian forces could kill them. The US only "provides battlefield intelligence to help Ukrainians defend their country", Pentagon Press Secretary John Kirby said. Ukraine makes its own decisions on whether to target a Russian leader or not, he added.

265.title: People called me the oldest newcomer: Sanjay Kapoor on 27 yrs of 'Prem'
265.article_body: Sanjay Kapoor on Thursday shared a post on Instagram marking the 27th anniversary of his debut film 'Prem'. Sharing an old picture with co-star Tabu, he wrote, "This...picture was taken...in 1990...had to wait for 3 years for...next schedule in 1993, the wait was extremely tough...people called me...oldest newcomer...Stayed positive and after 32 years I'm still doing what I love doing."

266.title: 49-yr-old man kills wife, lover with screwdriver in Hyderabad; arrested
266.article_body: Hyderabad police have arrested a 49-year-old man for killing his wife and her lover. The husband reportedly knew about his wife's affair and had warned her. On Sunday, the three went to the outskirts of the city where the accused attacked his wife and her lover with boulders and screwdriver after seeing them in an intimate position, police said.

267.title: Blue Corner notice issued against rape-accused actor Vijay Babu
267.article_body: A Blue Corner notice has been issued against actor Vijay Babu following a request by Kochi Police, who are probing a rape case against him. A Blue Corner notice is issued by Interpol to collect additional information from its member countries about a person's identity, location or activities in relation to a crime. Vijay is believed to be in Dubai.

268.title: Saudi Prince replies to Musk's 'How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own?' tweet
268.article_body: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal Al Saud has replied after Elon Musk asked, "How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own, directly & indirectly?" "I believe you will be an excellent leader for Twitter. Kingdom Holding Company and I look forward to roll our ~$1.9billion in the 'new' Twitter," Alwaleed tweeted. Earlier, Alwaleed opposed Musk's offer to buy Twitter.

269.title: Swiggy agent books Dunzo to deliver man's order in B'luru, chat goes viral
269.article_body: A Twitter user in Bengaluru shared a screenshot of his chat where he revealed that while he had ordered coffee via Swiggy, the delivery agent booked a Dunzo delivery partner to deliver the item. Reacting to his tweet that is now going viral, Dunzo replied, "In the @peakbengaluru metaverse of madness, Bichoo gang and Eagle gang work together."

270.title: People who backstabbed Balasaheb are now telling us about his thoughts: Raut
270.article_body: Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut criticised MNS chief Raj Thackeray and said, "Those people who backstabbed [Bal Thackeray] are now telling us about his thoughts and ideology." "These people have forgotten that today namaz is not offered on roads," Raut added. His statement comes after Raj Thackeray shared an old video of Bal Thackeray's speech on the removal of loudspeakers.

271.title: Andhra man carries 8-yr-old son's body on bike after being denied ambulance
271.article_body: A man was forced to carry his eight-year-old son's body on a motorbike to reach home after the hospital allegedly denied him an ambulance in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore. TDP chief N Chandrababu Naidu shared a video of the incident on Twitter, calling it a "horrifying episode of apathy and indifference". A similar incident had also occurred last week in Tirupati.

272.title: Man posing as minister's nephew dupes job aspirants across Mumbai, Thane
272.article_body: Mumbai Police has booked a man for allegedly posing as the nephew of Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut and duping several job aspirants. The accused had cheated more than 10 people across Mumbai, Thane and Mira Bhayandar areas. He allegedly took money from victims on the pretext of providing them jobs in Maharashtra State Electricity Distribution Company Ltd (MSEDCL).

273.title: Punjab Police arrests BJP's Bagga from Delhi home over alleged threat to Kejriwal
273.article_body: Punjab Police on Friday arrested BJP spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga from his Delhi home, Aam Aadmi Party MLA Naresh Balyan tweeted. Bagga had allegedly threatened Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal over his remarks on 'The Kashmir Files'. "Bagga has been arrested by 50 police personnel of Punjab Police...he is a true Sikh...they cannot threaten him," BJP's Kapil Mishra said.

274.title: UP school principal asks students to dress up in Eid attire; booked
274.article_body: Bushra Mustafa, principal of a private school in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj, was booked for allegedly asking students to dress up in salwar kurta with Eid cap (boys) and salwar kurta with dupatta (girls) and record a video saying 'Happy Eid'. Mustafa told police that she did it to maintain equality, so students of all faiths know about each other's religions.

275.title: US limits use of J&J COVID-19 vaccine due to rare blood clot risk
275.article_body: US' Food and Drug Administration (FDA) said it's limiting the use of Johnson & Johnson's COVID-19 vaccine for adults due to the ongoing risk of rare but serious blood clots. The shot should only be given to people who cannot receive a different vaccine or specifically request J&J's vaccine, FDA said. Around 18.7 million Americans have received a J&J shot.

276.title: Expected Pant's captaincy to be way better, surprised by his moves: Jaffer
276.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said he expected DC captain Rishabh Pant's captaincy to be a lot better, adding that he has been surprised by some of Pant's decisions in IPL 2022 so far. "On the batting front as well, Pant has not lit up IPL 2022," stated Jaffer. "DC need him to contribute...to take them to the playoffs," said Jaffer.

277.title: 1st stretch of Bengaluru-Mysuru expressway to open in July: Mysuru MP
277.article_body: The first stretch of the Bengaluru-Mysuru Expressway will likely be opened for public use in July, Mysuru MP Pratap Simha said. "The 56-km stretch from Bengaluru-Nidaghatta will be launched in July and the following stretch from Nidaghatta-Mysuru will be completed by Dasara," Simha tweeted. Notably, the expressway is expected to reduce the travel time from 3 hours to 90 minutes.

278.title: No shortage of coal in India, govt ready if problem arises: MSME Minister
278.article_body: Minister of State for Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSMEs) Bhanu Pratap Singh Verma said there is no shortage of coal in India. He added that if such a problem arises, the government is ready to deal with it. Notably, hundreds of passenger trains were cancelled last week for movement of coal carriages amid the apparent power crisis in India.

279.title: 6-yr-old girl raped in MP; accused's house bulldozed within 24 hrs
279.article_body: A six-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a shopkeeper in Madhya Pradesh's Morena after he lured her to a room behind the shop using chocolate and biscuits. Within 24 hours of the case being filed, the district administration bulldozed the accused's house in the presence of the Sub-Divisional Magistrate, an SHO said. The girl has been admitted to a hospital.

280.title: B'wood needs to be a part of MCU, bring in 1st Indian superhero: Benedict
280.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch has suggested that Bollywood should also be a part of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU). "Maybe have a massive dance and bring in the first Indian superhero," he added. "There are incredible Indian actors, whether they are born in the UK like obviously Sir Ben Kingsley or Dev Patel," Benedict further said.

281.title: PM Modi's 2017 Israel visit was 'goosebumps moment' for me: Jaishankar
281.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said that India and Israel have a truly special relationship and since PM Narendra Modi visited the country in 2017, the relationship has "really taken off". "For me the goosebumps moment in a way was at Tel Aviv when the PM visited Israel in July 2017, the first Indian PM to visit Israel," he added.

282.title: GOQii aims to help customers defeat diabetes, offers gold & more rewards
282.article_body: GOQii has announced #DefeatDiabetes, a national campaign where people can win gold and other rewards by reducing HbA1c levels by 1 percentage point in 6 months. The GOQii Diabetes Care program is backed by smart technology, personal coaching, doctor consultations and ISO certified health services on the GOQii app.

283.title: Don't patronise us: India's UN envoy to Dutch envoy on abstaining in UNGA on Ukraine
283.article_body: India's UN Ambassador TS Tirumurti while replying to a tweet by the Ambassador of the Netherlands to the UK on India abstaining in the UN General Assembly on Ukraine, said, "Kindly don't patronise us. We know what to do." Meanwhile, the Dutch envoy had tweeted, "You should not have abstained in the GA. Respect the UN Charter."

284.title: India reports 3,545 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 19,688
284.article_body: India has reported 3,545 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,275 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in India stand at 19,688, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,002, according to the latest data.

285.title: DC troll Umran Malik for giving away four runs off the fastest ball of IPL 2022
285.article_body: Delhi Capitals (DC) trolled SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik for being hit for a four off the fastest delivery of IPL 2022. Umran bowled a 157-kmph delivery in DC's last over, with Rovman Powell scoring a boundary off it. "Came in at 157 kmph, went back at 200...A Powell welcome for Umran," DC tweeted.

286.title: Which players have hit the most sixes after 50 matches in IPL 2022?
286.article_body: After the conclusion of 50 matches in IPL 2022, RR opener Jos Buttler has hit the most number of sixes in the season so far, with 36 maximums. He is followed by PBKS' Liam Livingstone, who has smashed 23 sixes. KKR's Andre Russell has hit 22 sixes, while RR captain Sanju Samson has slammed 21 maximums.

287.title: Bodies of 3 youths found from Zanzari waterfall in Gujarat
287.article_body: The bodies of three Ahmedabad-based youths were retrieved from the Zanzari waterfall in Gujarat's Dabha by the National Disaster Response Force (NDRF). The deceased, all in their twenties, had arrived at the waterfall on Wednesday evening. "Around 7 pm, we received news of three young men drowning in the...waterfalls. Immediately local divers were contacted," officials said.

288.title: Israeli series Fauda's actor Tsahi sings 'Tere Jaisa Yaar' at embassy's event in Delhi
288.article_body: Israeli actor Tsahi Halevi, who gained fame after the series 'Fauda', sang 'Tere Jaisa Yaar' on the occasion of the 74th Independence Day of his country. Halevi sang it at an event organised by the Embassy of Israel in Delhi. The event also commemorated 30 years of diplomatic ties between India and Israel.

289.title: He'll want to do something special: Chawla on Hardik facing his ex-team MI
289.article_body: Cricketer-commentator Piyush Chawla said GT captain Hardik Pandya will want to do "something special" against his former franchise MI. "It may be at the back of Hardik's mind that MI released him," added Chawla. Talking about GT opener Shubman Gill, Chawla stated that Gill needs to lift his game having played "only two" good knocks in IPL 2022 so far.

290.title: Putin apologised for Foreign Minister's 'Hitler had Jewish blood' remark: Israel
290.article_body: Israel's Prime Minister Naftali Bennett has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin apologised for remarks made by Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov, who claimed Adolf Hitler had "Jewish blood". Lavrov made the remark to try to justify Russia's portrayal of Ukraine as "Nazi" despite the fact that its President Volodymyr Zelenskyy is Jewish.

291.title: Worried about Kohli's strike rate, various bowlers dismissing him: Bishop
291.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Ian Bishop said he is "concerned" about Virat Kohli's strike rate in IPL 2022, as well as the fact that different types of bowlers are dismissing him. "If you are not getting ahead of the run-rate...you need to bat deep into the innings. And Kohli isn't going deep into the innings either," added Bishop.

292.title: Russian troops have destroyed nearly 400 hospitals: Ukraine Prez
292.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that Russian troops have "destroyed or damaged" nearly 400 hospitals and other medical institutions. "This amounts to a complete lack of medication for cancer patients. It means extreme difficulties or a complete lack of insulin for diabetes. It's impossible to carry out surgery. It even means, quite simply, a lack of antibiotics," Zelenskyy added.

293.title: Tushar Giri Nath appointed as Bengaluru civic body's new head
293.article_body: Ahead of Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) elections, the Karnataka government on Thursday announced the transfer of the civic body's Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta and has appointed IAS officer Tushar Giri Nath as the new head. Nath was previously the Principal Secretary in the state's Revenue Department. Gupta was appointed as BBMP Chief Commissioner last year.

294.title: Man dies after setting himself, friend on fire in northeast Delhi
294.article_body: A 38-year-old man died after setting himself on fire while his woman friend (38) has sustained serious injuries in northeast Delhi's Mandoli area. The two were allegedly in a relationship despite being married to other people, police said. Notably, the incident, which seems like a crime of passion, happened after the duo had an altercation over a mangalsutra, police said.

295.title: Alibaba briefly loses $26 bn in market value after a man surnamed 'Ma' is held
295.article_body: The arrest of a man surnamed 'Ma' in China led to shares of Jack Ma's Alibaba falling by almost 10% within minutes on May 3, briefly erasing about $26 billion of market value. The Chinese state-run media had reported that the man was arrested for alleged national security violations. After the media issued a clarification, Alibaba's shares recovered their losses.

296.title: Pune's rural areas record higher COVID vaccination rates than urban areas
296.article_body: Over the last few days, the COVID-19 vaccination rates in the Pune district have been recorded higher in the district's rural areas than those in the urban areas, said the data of the CoWin app. Notably, over 11,741 jabs were given on May 4 in Pune's rural areas while 5,632 jabs were given in the district's urban areas.

297.title: Over 10 lakh people visit Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah in two days during Eid
297.article_body: The number of visitors at Mumbai's Haji Ali Dargah crossed 10-lakh mark on Eid and the day after it, which earlier used to be around two to three lakh. "This year we were taken aback with the huge response of the crowd, it crossed nearly a million...because of the two-year gap due to lockdown," Managing Trustee of the dargah said.

298.title: 40-year-old man who 'forcibly undressed' 2 girls in Delhi school detained
298.article_body: Delhi Police detained a 40-year-old man in connection with the molestation of girl students in a civic body-run school in the Northeast district. The man had allegedly sexually assaulted two girls, forcibly taken off their clothes and urinated in front of an entire class. "We spoke to the girls...based on their description, a sketch was made," police said.

299.title: 4,500 fined ₹22 lakh in 12 days for not wearing masks in Delhi
299.article_body: More than 4,500 people were fined over ₹22 lakh between April 23 and May 4 for not wearing masks in Delhi amid COVID-19 pandemic, according to government data. The maximum number of fines were imposed in East district on 1,133 people followed by New Delhi at 705. "We are averaging around 100 challans per day," a Southeast district official said.

300.title: Ridership increases in Mumbai's AC local trains on Day 1 of lower fares
300.article_body: The Western Railway (WR) witnessed a 30% increase in ridership on its air-conditioned (AC) coaches on Thursday, which was the first day of the Railways' implementation of revised single-journey ticket fares for passengers. Over 5,360 people boarded AC local trains till 5 pm on Thursday. The price of tickets for AC locals is reduced by over 50% on single journeys.

301.title: Musk's $44-billion Twitter deal under review by US FTC: Report
301.article_body: The US FTC is reviewing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $44 billion Twitter deal, Bloomberg News reported. The FTC will decide in June if it will do an in-depth antitrust probe of the proposed transaction. Musk's initial purchase of a 9% Twitter stake is already under an FTC probe to see if he complied with an antitrust reporting requirement.

302.title: Over 550 kg drugs worth ₹42 cr seized this year in Mumbai: Police
302.article_body: The Mumbai Police have seized 550 kilograms of drugs from January to March this year and have arrested 2,897 persons for being allegedly involved in drug cases in the city. The total value of the seized contraband stands at ₹42.25 crore. According to data provided by the police, ganja has been the most seized contraband in the city.

303.title: 3 killed in stabbing attack in Israel on Independence Day
303.article_body: At least three people were killed in a stabbing attack in Israel's Elad as the country marked its Independence Day on Thursday. Police said they suspect it was a terrorist attack and that the militants escaped in a vehicle. Condemning the "murderous attack", Israel's Foreign Minister Yair Lapid said, "The joy of Independence Day had been interrupted in an instant."

304.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read with 20 matches remaining?
304.article_body: With 20 matches left in the league stage, GT are on top of the IPL 2022 points table. GT have won eight out of their 10 matches so far. LSG, who have won three matches in a row, are second. CSK are placed ninth on the table, while five-time champions MI are last. Meanwhile, RR are third on the table.

305.title: Delhi Police apprehends 13-year-old boy for drowning baby in water tank
305.article_body: Delhi Police apprehended a 13-year-old boy for allegedly killing an eight-month-old baby by drowning him in a rooftop water tank of his house in Delhi's Dallupura. The accused had a grudge against the mother of the infant, police said. The juvenile had an impression that the deceased's mother had complained about him to his mother, police added.

306.title: Karine to be 1st black and 1st openly LGBTQ+ person to serve as WH Press Secy
306.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday named Karine Jean-Pierre as the next White House Press Secretary. Jean-Pierre will replace Jen Psaki, under whom she served as deputy, from May 13. "She will be the first black and the first openly LGBTQ+ person to serve as the White House Press Secretary," Psaki tweeted after the announcement.

307.title: Pune rly police arrest 2 for call seeking ₹7cr for bomb threat info
307.article_body: Pune railway police have arrested two men for making a hoax bomb threat call to the railway authorities. A man had demanded ₹7 crore for information about the bomb's location during the call, which was made on Tuesday around 4pm. The railway police said that there was a "huge police presence" at the station which caused "fear among the civilians".

308.title: Woman police official arrests own fiancé on charges of fraud in Assam
308.article_body: A woman police official of the Assam Police lodged an FIR and arrested her own fiancé on charges of fraud. The accused, who posed as an ONGC employee, allegedly asked people for money on the pretext of giving them a job with the company. The couple got engaged in October last year and were set to get married in November.

309.title: Virus found in pig heart transplanted into man in US
309.article_body: While trying to learn what killed the first person to receive a heart transplant from a pig, researchers discovered the organ harboured an animal virus, called porcine cytomegalovirus. However researchers did not say if the virus played any role in the man's death. David Bennett Sr, from US' Maryland, died in March, two months after the groundbreaking experimental transplant.

310.title: Schools can't force parents to buy costly books, uniforms: Delhi govt
310.article_body: Private schools cannot force parents to buy expensive books and uniforms from a specific vendor, an order by Delhi's Directorate of Education said. Schools must display information of at least five shops where its books and uniforms shall be made available and class-wise list of books in upcoming session must be communicated to parents well in advance, the order stated.

311.title: Warner smashes 92*(58) as DC hand SRH their 3rd defeat in a row in IPL 2022
311.article_body: DC defeated SRH by 21 runs on Thursday to jump to the fifth position on the IPL 2022 points table. DC opener David Warner smashed 92*(58) against his former team as DC put up a total of 207/3. SRH were restricted to 186/8 as Khaleel Ahmed took three wickets against his former team. SRH have now lost three straight matches.

312.title: AR Rahman's daughter Khatija gets married, singer shares pic
312.article_body: Singer-composer AR Rahman's daughter Khatija Rahman got married to Riyasdeen Shaik Mohamed. "May the Almighty bless the couple...thanking you in advance for your good wishes and love," the singer wrote while sharing a picture from the ceremony on Instagram. Riyasdeen is an audio engineer and aspiring entrepreneur. The couple got engaged in December 2021.

313.title: It has been so long, I don't care: Zaheer on rumours of dating Sonakshi
313.article_body: Actor Zaheer Iqbal, reacting to dating rumours with Sonakshi Sinha, has said, "Now it has been so long, I don't even care." "I am like okay if you think, then you think. Keep thinking. It's good for you," he added. Zaheer further revealed that actor Salman Khan had advised him not to pay too attention to such things.

314.title: Tesla asks India team to work for APAC amid high import duty: Report
314.article_body: US-based electric carmaker Tesla has reportedly asked its Indian team to start working for the Asia-Pacific market as import duties here remain high despite Tesla working for a tax break since 2019. Most employees have travelled to Dubai and are working for the Middle East markets, ET reported. Currently, India charges a 100% import duty on EVs worth over $40,000.

315.title: Was a sudden attack of diarrhoea: Mumtaz on being hospitalised
315.article_body: Veteran actress Mumtaz, who was admitted to the hospital because of a severe stomach infection, has said that she suffers from Irritable Bowel Syndrome and Colitis. "It was a sudden attack of diarrhoea which didn't stop despite the best of medication. Hence, hospitalisation was required," she stated. Mumtaz added, "In the hospital too, it took me seven days to normalise."

316.title: Jail officials neglected my wife Navneet's health issues: MLA Ravi
316.article_body: Maharashtra MLA Ravi Rana said that officials of Byculla women's jail in Mumbai neglected his MP wife Navneet Rana's health issues even after she requested hospitalisation. The duo was arrested on April 23 after they threatened to chant the Hanuman Chalisa outside Maharashtra Chief Minister Uddhav Thackeray's residence. They were granted bail by a Mumbai sessions court on Wednesday.

317.title: UP CM inaugurates ₹43-crore guest house for tourists in Haridwar
317.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath inaugurated a guest house for tourists in Uttarakhand's Haridwar along with the state CM Pushkar Singh Dhami. The guest house, which is said to be worth ₹43.27 crore, has 100 rooms and was built by the Uttar Pradesh government. "Uttarakhand has ample opportunities for eco-tourism along with spiritual tourism," Yogi Adityanath said.

318.title: Audio of Johnny Depp 'howling like an animal' while he was intoxicated played in court
318.article_body: An audio of Johnny Depp "howling like an animal" while he was intoxicated on a private flight from Boston to Los Angeles in 2014 was played in court during the ongoing defamation trial. His ex-wife, actress Amber Heard said she recorded it because he wouldn't remember how bad it was afterwards. Heard further said he reeked of "weed and alcohol".

319.title: David Warner records most fifties in T20 cricket, breaks Chris Gayle's record
319.article_body: DC opener David Warner on Thursday smashed his 89th fifty in T20 cricket, scoring 92*(58) against SRH in their IPL 2022 clash. With this, Warner set the record for scoring the most number of fifties in T20 cricket, overtaking Chris Gayle (88). Apart from 89 fifties, Warner has also hit eight T20 hundreds. Meanwhile, Gayle has slammed 22 T20 hundreds.

320.title: Which investors are giving Musk over $7 billion in new financing to buy Twitter?
320.article_body: Elon Musk has secured a new financing commitment of $7.139 billion for his $44 billion Twitter buyout. Investors include Binance, Oracle Co-founder Larry Ellison, Brookfield, Fidelity, Qatar Holding, Sequoia Capital Fund, Aliya Capital, Honeycomb & Vy Capital among others. Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, who initially opposed the buyout, has agreed to roll his $1.89 billion stake into the deal.

321.title: What is Shigella, the bacteria that killed a girl after she ate shawarma in Kerala?
321.article_body: Shigella bacteria was the cause for the food poisoning incident in Kerala, which claimed the life of a 16-year-old girl, who consumed chicken shawarma from an eatery. It causes an infection called shigellosis. Most people with Shigella infection have diarrhea (sometimes bloody), fever and stomach cramps.  People with severe illness and those with underlying conditions should be given antibiotics.

322.title: Bitcoin drops 8.4% to $36,639 in biggest drop in almost a month
322.article_body: World's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin registered the biggest drop in almost a month on Thursday. It fell as much as 8.4% to $36,639 today after gaining 5.3% on Wednesday, which is the biggest intraday drop since April 11. Meanwhile, altcoins Ethereum, Avalanche and Solana were also down by 7.2%, 11% and 7.3% respectively.

323.title: Rajasthan Technical University VC caught taking bribe of ₹5 lakh
323.article_body: Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) officials said Rajasthan Technical University Vice Chancellor RA Gupta was caught taking a bribe of ₹5 lakh at a government guest house in Jaipur. He reportedly demanded the money for increasing the number of engineering seats at a private university. An ACB official said that ₹21 lakh cash was recovered from his room.

324.title: 25,000 houses in Delhi to get free sewer connections: Govt
324.article_body: Delhi Jal Board has announced that 25,000 households in East Delhi will be provided free sewer connections under 'Mukhyamantri Muft Sewer Connection Yojana'. An amount of ₹19 crore has been allocated for this and the connection will be provided in 12 colonies in Karawal Nagar and Mustafabad. The decision was taken at a meeting chaired by board Chairman Satyendar Jain.

325.title: Singhdeo files complaint against BJP's Kapil Mishra for defaming Rahul Gandhi
325.article_body: Chhattisgarh Minister TS Singhdeo on Thursday filed a police complaint against BJP leaders Kapil Mishra and Harish Khurana, and retired Major Surendra Poonia for defaming Congress leader Rahul Gandhi through their tweets. Social media posts by Mishra, Khurana and Poonia saying Gandhi had a secret meeting with the Chinese Ambassador to Nepal are "utterly false and malicious", the complaint read.

326.title: Shah should focus on incidents in Delhi, UP instead of WB: Mamata
326.article_body: Reacting to Home Minister Amit Shah's comments on TMC, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that he should concentrate on what happened in Delhi's Jahangirpuri and Uttar Pradesh instead of West Bengal. "Don't do things to bulldoze the democratic structure of the country," she said. Amit Shah had accused TMC of spreading rumours that the CAA will not be implemented.

327.title: K'taka Police recruitment scam: Dy SP, Inspector, 5 constables held
327.article_body: A Deputy Superintendent of Police, Inspector and five constables were arrested on Thursday for their alleged role in the malpractices during the October 2021 examination for recruiting 545 Sub-Inspectors. The allegation is that the mentioned police officers did not report malpractices at the centres they were in charge of during the exam.

328.title: Edtech unicorn Vedantu lays off 200 employees
328.article_body: Edtech unicorn Vedantu has laid off 120 contract-based and 80 full-time employees constituting 3.5% of Vedantu's 6,000-people workforce. "Academics or assistant teachers were being reevaluated. We have an annual contract, and at the beginning of every academic year, we follow a process of load rebalancing," Vedantu said. Recently, edtech startups Unacademy and Lido also announced layoffs.

329.title: 5 bodies recovered from river Ganga in Bihar's Buxar
329.article_body: Officials said that five bodies were recovered from river Ganga in Bihar's Buxar district, adding four bodies were of males while the fifth body was that of a woman. "It seems family members of all the deceased may have thrown the bodies in the river after they were handed to them after autopsy," Buxar SDO Dhirendra Kumar Mishra said.

330.title: TVS elevates Sudarshan Venu as Managing Director
330.article_body: Sudarshan Venu, son of Venu Srinivasan, on Thursday took over as the Managing Director of TVS Motor Company. Sudarshan was earlier the joint MD of the firm. Accepting his new role, Sudarshan said, "With the continued guidance of my father and Sir Ralf (TVS Chairman) and the support of the board...I look forward to further embracing the future of mobility."

331.title: Lost sense of smell due to brain haemorrhage after domestic abuse: Poonam
331.article_body: Actress Poonam Pandey has revealed that she has lost her sense of smell completely after the domestic violence she suffered at the hands of her ex-husband Sam Bombay. "When the domestic violence happened to me, I lost the sense of smell completely. With brain haemorrhage, it is connected," she stated. "I ask people around me about the smell," Poonam added.

332.title: Thousands face breathing issues due to severe dust storms in Iraq: Report
332.article_body: More than 3,000 people faced breathing problems and sought medical help after a dust storm hit Iraq's capital Baghdad on Thursday, medical officials said. According to a report, one person has died due to the same in Baghdad. Iraq has reportedly seen an increasing number of dust, sand and windstorms in recent years, including several in recent weeks.

333.title: Joke isn't on your son: Kamra to man over edited video of his son who sang for PM
333.article_body: Stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra responded after a man criticised him for posting edited video of his son who sang for PM Narendra Modi in Germany. "The joke isn't on your son. While you enjoy your son sing for his motherland to the most popular son, there are songs he should listen to from people of his country also," Kamra tweeted.

334.title: Prashant Kishor is a political businessman: Bihar BJP leader
334.article_body: Former BJP MP and senior BJP leader from Bihar Hukumdev Narayan Yadav called Prashant Kishor a political businessman. "Don't call Prashant Kishor a strategist, he is a political businessman and it is not right for people to discuss businessmen in such an important way," Yadav said. His comment comes after Kishor announced a 3,000 km Padyatra from October 2.

335.title: NATO will increase presence in Baltic sea if Sweden applies: Stoltenberg
335.article_body: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg has said that bloc will strengthen its presence around Sweden's borders and Baltic sea if the country applies to join NATO. He added that bloc will have "very strong obligation" to guarantee the country's security amid potential membership bid. Stoltenberg's remarks come amid reports that Sweden and Finland will formally apply to join NATO in May.

336.title: Delhi will become the startup destination of the world: Kejriwal
336.article_body: After the Delhi Cabinet approved a start-up policy, CM Arvind Kejriwal said that Delhi will become the startup destination of the world. The start-up policy approved by the Cabinet seeks to provide youth with financial assistance to set up companies. "Creating entrepreneurs and business leaders out of our youth is a subject very close to my heart," he said.

337.title: Impartial probe into K'taka PSI scam has begun: Basavaraj Bommai
337.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that an impartial probe in the alleged police sub-inspector (PSI) recruitment scam has begun. He assured all those involved will be booked and brought to justice. "We have arrested more than 20 people in the PSI scam," Bommai said. All complaints, details and documents related to the PSI scam will be considered, he added.

338.title: BJP won't return to power in 2024, CAA won't be implemented: Mamata
338.article_body: Responding to BJP leader Amit Shah's claim that CAA will be implemented when COVID-19 subsides, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that BJP won't return to power in 2024 and CAA won't be implemented. "The CAA bill has lapsed. Why are they not bringing this bill to Parliament? I don't want the rights of citizens to be curbed," she said.

339.title: Take all steps to avoid deaths due to heatwave: PM Modi to officials
339.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday chaired a high-level meeting to review preparations for heatwave and monsoon season. He asked officials to take all measures to avoid loss of life due to heatwave or fire incidents. "Holistic efforts needed to reduce the vulnerability of forests in the country against fire hazards," PM Modi added.

340.title: US stocks fall after Federal Reserve raises interest rates by 50 bps
340.article_body: US stocks fell after the Federal Reserve raised interest rates by 50 bps on Wednesday, citing elevated inflation. While Nasdaq Composite fell 546.15 points to 12,418.70 and registered a 4.21% drop, S&P 500 fell 130.19 points to 4,169.98 and registered a 3.03% drop in the early hours of trading. Dow Jones Industrial Average also fell 2.58% to touch 33,182.33 points.

341.title: Madhavan's Rocketry: The Nambi Effect to premiere at Cannes on May 19
341.article_body: R Madhavan's 'Rocketry: The Nambi Effect' will be premiering at the Cannes Film Festival on May 19. Taking to Instagram, Madhavan wrote, "Did not imagine this when we began this journey." The film is based on aerospace engineer Nambi Narayanan. Actor Shah Rukh Khan will have a cameo in the Hindi and English versions of the film.

342.title: Will probe Imran Khan's 'foreign conspiracy' claim: Pakistan minister
342.article_body: Pakistan minister Marriyum Aurangzeb said on Thursday that government will form a commission to probe ex-PM Imran Khan's claim that 'foreign conspiracy' allegedly led to his ouster. Aurangzeb said the commission will be unbiased and headed by a person "no one will be able to point fingers at". Imran Khan was ousted through no-trust vote in parliament on April 10.

343.title: Old pics show Johnny Depp allegedly passed out after using drugs
343.article_body: Jury was shown images of Johnny Depp allegedly passed out after using drugs, as ex-wife Amber Heard continued her testimony. Court was shown a picture of Depp appearing to be asleep, which Heard said was taken in the Bahamas and came after a "stint of sobriety". Another picture shows Depp slumped forward. Heard said he was "on a drugs binge".

344.title: Child rights body seeks action against Kamra over edited video of boy who sang for PM
344.article_body: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights wrote to Twitter and Delhi Police, seeking action against stand-up comedian Kunal Kamra for posting edited video of a boy who sang for PM Narendra Modi in Germany. NCPCR sought removal of the video. The boy's father had threatened Kamra with legal action, saying, "Keep the poor boy out of your filthy politics."

345.title: Alia Bhatt to appear on Koffee with Karan with Ranveer Singh: Report
345.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt and actor Ranveer Singh will reportedly feature in the first episode of Karan Johar's show 'Koffee with Karan'. According to a report by Pinkvilla, Alia and Ranveer will be shooting for this episode around May 10. Earlier, it was reported that Alia will come to the show along with her husband and actor Ranbir Kapoor.

346.title: Will decide on Moldova's request to join EU by June-end: Official
346.article_body: European Union (EU) will decide on Moldova's request to join the bloc by end of June, an official confirmed on Thursday. The announcement comes after the EU pledged more military support for the country amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine. Notably, Moldova is a former Soviet republic and had formally applied to join the bloc in March.

347.title: Govt asks VPN providers to store user data for 5 years or face up to 1 year in jail
347.article_body: The government's CERT-In requires VPN service providers to collect and hold user data for five years or longer under new rules applicable from June-end. Non-compliance may invite punitive action under subsection (7) of section 70B of the IT Act, 2000. Non-compliance may lead to up to one year of imprisonment or a fine of up to ₹1 lakh, or both.

348.title: You've given me my family back: Shark Tank contestant to Ashneer in a letter
348.article_body: Rakhi Pal, the Co-founder of student community startup EventBeep which received investments from Ashneer Grover, Aman Gupta and Peyush Bansal on Shark Tank India, thanked Ashneer in a letter.
