"You've given me my family back and their trust in this vision," Rakhi wrote to Ashneer. During the show, Rakhi had said that her family disowned her over her startup work.

349.title: EU regulator warns of potential risk to civil planes amid Ukraine war
349.article_body: European Union's Aviation Safety Agency (EASA) warned on Thursday that there's an increased risk of civil planes being accidentally targetted in Ukraine war. "Misidentification is easy in confused arenas of warfare. The development of this risk is common to all combatants," the regulator said. EASA added that there were also risks related to increase in military operations using civilian airports.

350.title: Oil crosses $110 mark after EU plans phased ban on Russian oil
350.article_body: Oil price on Thursday crossed the $110 mark after the European Union laid out plans to place a phased ban on all Russian oil imports. Brent crude rose 1.4% to $111.73/barrel while US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) rose 1.2% to $109.11/barrel. "Today, we'll propose...a complete import ban on all Russian oil," EU chief Ursula von der Leyen said on Wednesday.

351.title: BJP won't rest till it uproots Mamata's TMC from Bengal: Amit Shah
351.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday said that the BJP will not rest till it ends CM Mamata Banerjee's Trinamool Congress' rule from West Bengal. "Bengal is the only Indian state where the price of petrol is ₹115 per litre. In BJP-ruled states, the price is ₹105. The Bengal government charges 25% VAT besides local state tax," Shah said.

352.title: Japan to freeze assets of 140 more Russian individuals: PM Kishida
352.article_body: Japanese PM Fumio Kishida on Thursday said that the country would freeze the assets of 140 more Russian individuals over its invasion of Ukraine. He said that an export ban will be expanded to Russian military firms. Kishida said it's time for the G7 to solidify its unity, adding that it must be shown that there're consequences to Russia's violence.

353.title: Karnal terror suspects could just be explosive transporters: Khattar
353.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Thursday said that it's not clear if the four terror suspects detained in Karnal are terrorists or pawns of the terror organisations being used to transport explosives. Karnal SP Ganga Ram Punia said that the accused were caught with a desi pistol, 31 live ammunition, three iron containers with explosives and around ₹1.3 lakh.

354.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana cries as husband visits her in hospital 12 days after arrest
354.article_body: Maharashtra MP Navneet Rana broke down in tears on meeting her MLA husband Ravi Rana at Lilavati Hospital in Mumbai on Thursday. Navneet was released from the Byculla jail and her husband was released from Taloja jail 12 days after they were arrested over the Hanuman Chalisa issue. Navneet has been admitted to Lilavati Hospital due to health issues.

355.title: WHO claims India had 47 lakh Covid deaths, 10 times more than estimate; govt objects
355.article_body: A WHO report has estimated that there were 47 lakh Covid-19 deaths in India from January 2020 till December 2021 end, which is nearly 10 times the official figures. India rejected the estimates by calling data collection methodology "questionable" and said, "Despite India's objection to the process, methodology and outcome of this modelling exercise, WHO released the excess mortality estimates."

356.title: Umran Malik bowls the fastest delivery of IPL 2022, breaks own record
356.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad (SRH) fast bowler Umran Malik on Thursday bowled the fastest delivery of IPL 2022 so far after clocking 154.8 kmph against Delhi Capitals (DC) opener David Warner on Thursday. The 22-year-old broke his own record of 154 kmph. He had clocked 154 kmph twice in SRH's match against Chennai Super Kings (CSK) on May 1.

357.title: ISRO planning to launch mission to Venus in December 2024
357.article_body: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is readying a spacecraft to orbit Venus, the solar system's hottest planet. Addressing a day-long meeting, ISRO Chairman S Somanath said the Venus mission has been conceived, a project report made and "money identified". ISRO is eyeing the December 2024 window for its launch with orbital maneuvers planned for the following year.

358.title: Nushrratt gets vulgar comments for playing condom salesgirl, shares video
358.article_body: Nushrratt Bharuccha shared vulgar comments she received on social media for playing a condom salesgirl in her upcoming film 'Janhit Mein Jaari'. In the video shared on Instagram, Nushrratt said, "This is the thinking we need to change." She shared the comments in the video. A user on Facebook commented, "Madam that thing is not for the jeans."

359.title: Gucci to start accepting crypto payments in some US stores
359.article_body: Italian fashion company Gucci has announced that customers can pay with crypto at some of its flagship stores in the US starting later this month. The company will accept various digital currencies including bitcoin, ethereum, dogecoin, shiba inu, litecoin and a few US dollar-pegged stablecoins. The service will be expanded to its directly operated North America stores soon.

360.title: Ola Cars CEO Arun Sirdeshmukh resigns less than a year after launch
360.article_body: Ola Cars CEO Arun Sirdeshmukh has resigned less than a year after the vehicle sales business was launched, an Ola spokesperson told the Economic Times. Sirdeshmukh's roles as Ola Cars CEO and the Go-to-Market head of Ola Electric will now be under Group Ola CFO Arun Kumar GR, the spokesperson said. This comes amid concerns over quality of Ola e-scooters.

361.title: US condemns attack at Karachi University that killed 4 people
361.article_body: The US has condemned the suicide attack that occurred inside the premises of the University of Karachi in Pakistan and killed four people. US State Department Spokesperson Ned Price said, "A terrorist attack anywhere is an affront to humanity everywhere." "But for a terrorist attack to take place at...university...we've seen recently, that is a true affront to mankind," Price added.

362.title: Ukrainian Prez launches crowdfunding platform to win war with Russia
362.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has launched a global crowdfunding platform to help the country win its war with Russia. Zelenskyy said, "[You] can donate funds to...save our civilians...to rebuild Ukraine." He said that all funds will be transferred to Ukraine's national bank, adding that the government would give an update "every 24 hours" about how the money was being used.

363.title: TN announces free travel for children below 5 yrs in govt buses
363.article_body: Tamil Nadu government said on Thursday that children aged less than 5 years will be exempted from paying fares in buses operated by government-run transport bodies. Transport Minister SS Sivasankar, who made announcement, added that automated travel ticket system, redressal body for passengers will be set up. Currently, children aged between 3 and 12 years need to pay 'half fare'.

364.title: Omar Abdullah mistakenly announces party MP's death, apologises later
364.article_body: National Conference leader Omar Abdullah on Thursday apologised for mistakenly announcing the death of party MP Akbar Lone. Abdullah had earlier announced that Lone died after a brief illness in Srinagar. "Lone is admitted to SKIMS for respiratory infection and is responding well to the treatment," the hospital also issued a statement.

365.title: 'KGF: Chapter 2' becomes 2nd-highest earning film in Hindi ever
365.article_body: 'KGF: Chapter 2' has surpassed the lifetime business of the film 'Dangal' and is now the second-highest grossing film in Hindi ever. "Glorious march towards ₹400 crore begins," tweeted film trade analyst Taran Adarsh. The top three highest grossing films in Hindi are 'Baahubali 2', 'KGF 2' and 'Dangal'. 'KGF 2' has earned over ₹1,000 crore worldwide.

366.title: Insurgent groups are involved in poppy cultivation: Manipur CM
366.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh said that some insurgent groups of Manipur were involved in poppy cultivation and drug smuggling from Myanmar border. Insurgency problems in Manipur and North-eastern regions had reduced upto 75%, he said. "My immediate need is to rehabilitate poppy planters for their livelihood," he added. He raised the issue during his interaction with the central government.

367.title: 70-year-old mentally challenged woman raped in UP, accused arrested
367.article_body: A 70-year-old mentally challenged woman was allegedly abducted and raped in a village in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur, following which the accused was arrested, police said on Thursday. She was abducted and taken to a secluded place by a man on Tuesday where he allegedly raped her, Additional Superintendent of Police (rural) Sanjeev Bajpai said.

368.title: Musk expected to be temporary Twitter CEO after buyout deal: Report
368.article_body: Elon Musk is expected to serve as Twitter's temporary CEO for a few months after he completes Twitter's $44 billion buyout, CNBC reported. Parag Agrawal is Twitter's current CEO after taking over the role from Co-founder Jack Dorsey in November 2021. A few days ago, Agrawal responded, "Nope! we're still here," to a Twitter user who thought Agrawal was fired.

369.title: Hindu man killed by his Muslim wife's family in Hyd; act caught on camera
369.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man, B Nagaraju, was attacked with rods and beaten to death by family of his Muslim wife Syed Ashrin Sulthana in Hyderabad, according to Sulthana's statement. "They killed my husband in the middle of the street. Five people attacked. My brother and others...killed him in front of my eyes," Sulthana said. The incident's video has also surfaced.

370.title: Facebook took action against 2.16 cr content pieces in India in March
370.article_body: Facebook 'actioned' against 2.16 crore pieces of content on the platform between March 1-31, Meta's compliance report released for March under the new IT Rules revealed. Of these content, 1.49 crore pieces were spam, followed by violent and graphic content at 25 lakh pieces. Facebook responded to all 656 reports it received through the Indian grievance mechanism, the report added.

371.title: Delimitation Commission will disempower J&K, extension of BJP: Mufti
371.article_body: After the Delimitation Commission submitted its final report on Thursday and recommended increasing the number of Assembly seats in Jammu and Kashmir, former CM Mehbooba Mufti called it an extension of the BJP. She added that the move is part of measures to disempower the people of the UT. J&K will now have 90 Assembly seats.

372.title: Actor Ajay Devgn reacts to rumours on fight with Shah Rukh Khan
372.article_body: Reacting to rumours of a fight with Shah Rukh Khan, actor Ajay Devgn has said, "The six-seven of us, who were from the 90's generation who started...together...we share a great rapport." "We speak over the phone, we're all fine," Ajay stated. The duo have never shared the screen in a film, however, have come together for a pan masala ad.

373.title: 'Rahul ji, are you ready for white challenge' posters seen in Hyd ahead of visit
373.article_body: Ahead of Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's visit to Telangana, posters have surfaced challenging him for a 'white challenge'. The 'white challenge' was started against the drug menace by Congress MP Revanth Reddy in September 2021. The posters, which have pictures from Gandhi's recent visit to a nightclub in Nepal, read, "Rahul ji, are you ready for a white challenge?"

374.title: Amit Shah inaugurates 3 floating border posts on India-Bangladesh border
374.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Thursday inaugurated three floating border posts on India-Bangladesh border, stating that Centre's prime goal is to enhance India's internal and external security. Shah inaugurated Narmada, Sutlej and Kaveri floating border posts to protect the inaccessible areas of Sundarbans. "The front part of these [posts] is...bulletproof for...safety of our jawans," he added.

375.title: SRH to bowl first against DC; DC make 4 changes, 3 players debut for SRH
375.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against DC in their IPL 2022 match on Thursday. DC have made four changes to their playing XI, with Mandeep Singh, Ripal Patel, Khaleel Ahmed and Anrich Nortje being included in the side. Meanwhile, Shreyas Gopal, Sean Abbott and Kartik Tyagi are debuting for SRH.

376.title: Delhi Startup Policy launched to provide financial, procedural help
376.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday announced the launch of Delhi Startup Policy, which aims to provide young entrepreneurs with financial and procedural help. "The government will provide collateral-free loan, financial parts of rent and employee salaries," Kejriwal said. He added that the government will form a panel of CAs and lawyers where entrepreneurs can seek help for free.

377.title: Armed men attack Christian school in Pakistan, demand extortion money
377.article_body: Fourteen armed men attacked a Christian school in Pakistan's Punjab province and demanded extortion money from the school's principal, according to a report. The principal said that the attackers hurled chairs at the children while they were praying and damaged vehicles of the staff, the report added. They also allegedly issued death threats and misbehaved with the school's female staff.

378.title: Hindu man killed by his Muslim wife's family in Hyd; act caught on camera
378.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man, B Nagaraju, was allegedly attacked with rods and beaten to death by the family of his Muslim wife Syed Ashrin Sulthana in Hyderabad, according to Sulthana's statement. A video of the attack has surfaced online, showing the man bleeding on a busy road. "They got married recently...Brothers of the deceased's wife assaulted Nagaraju," a policeman said.

379.title: Ukraine war has dragged on, doing everything to stop it: Belarus Prez
379.article_body: Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko has said that he didn't expect Ukraine war to "drag on this way", adding that he's doing everything he can to stop it. Lukashenko stated that using nuclear weapons in Ukraine is "unacceptable" because of the country's proximity to Belarus. Notably, his comments come amid Russia's recent simulated nuclear-capable missile strikes in its enclave of Kaliningrad.

380.title: Chief of B'luru-based ATREE elected to US' National Academy of Sciences
380.article_body: The chief of Bengaluru-based Ashoka Trust for Research in Ecology and the Environment (ATREE), Dr Kamal Bawa, has been elected to the US' National Academy of Sciences, according to a statement by ATREE. Dr Bawa said, "The election is...reaffirmation of our important work on the ecology, conservation and management of tropical forests that are declining...but are critical to humanity's well-being."

381.title: B'luru man kills 30-yr-old wife after celebrating his birthday, held
381.article_body: A 35-year-old man has been detained in Bengaluru on charges of allegedly killing his 30-year-old wife by strangling her to death. The accused allegedly killed his wife after she confronted him about his extra-marital affair. Doctors who checked the victim at the hospital suspected foul play after he told them she fell unconscious due to low blood pressure, reports said.

382.title: Andhra man accused of chain-snatching kills self in police custody
382.article_body: A suspect in a chain-snatching case, identified as Manipalli Appa Rao, allegedly died by suicide in police custody in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru. Police said that the man was arrested on May 1 and the incident took place when the accused went to take a bath. He was rushed to a hospital, but died during treatment, SP Rahul Dev Sharma said.

383.title: Johnny Depp forced Amber Heard to give him oral sex when he was angry: Psychologist
383.article_body: A clinical psychologist who testified at Johnny Depp's trial against Amber Heard said Depp forced Heard into oral sex when he was angry. "When Depp was drunk or high, he'd throw her on...bed, rip off her nightgown, and try to have sex with her," the psychologist, Dawn Hughes, testified. "These weren't in loving moments. These were angry moments," she said.

384.title: Hindu man allegedly killed by his Muslim wife's family in Hyd; act caught on camera
384.article_body: A 25-year-old Hindu man, B Nagaraju, was allegedly attacked with rods and beaten to death by the family of his Muslim wife Syed Ashrin Sulthana in Hyderabad, police said. A video of the attack has surfaced online, showing the man bleeding on a busy road. "They got married recently...Brothers of the deceased's wife assaulted Nagaraju," a police officer said.

385.title: Remove encroachment from Okhla within 2 weeks: HC to authorities
385.article_body: Delhi HC on Thursday directed authorities to take action for the removal of encroachment from Okhla Industrial Area within two weeks. It also directed Delhi Police to ensure sufficient force is provided to the concerned authorities. South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) and Delhi State Industrial and Infrastructure Development Corporation Limited will chalk out plan to remove the encroachment.

386.title: Delhi Police find no CCTV at MCD school where 2 girls were molested
386.article_body: Delhi Police didn't find any CCTVs installed inside the school where two girl students were allegedly molested by an unknown person inside their classroom in an MCD school. Based on the statements of the girls, a portrait of the accused has been sketched and two suspects have been zeroed in, police added.

387.title: India's biggest-ever IPO of LIC gets fully subscribed
387.article_body: LIC's IPO, India's biggest ever, was fully subscribed on the second day of bidding on Thursday.   The ₹20,557-crore IPO, with price band fixed at ₹902-949 per share, received bids for 16.24 crore equity shares against the offer size of 16.2 crore shares. The policyholder portion was subscribed 3.02 times, employee portion 2.14 times, and retail investors subscribed 91%.

388.title: Why is LIC  being sold at a throwaway price?: Rahul Gandhi on LIC IPO
388.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi accused the PM Narendra Modi-led government of "undervaluing" LIC, and questioned, "Why is one of India's most valuable assets being sold at a throwaway price?" India's largest-ever IPO of LIC, where the government is selling its 3.5% stake, expects to raise ₹20,557 crore. The LIC issue was fully subscribed on Thursday, the second day of bidding.

389.title: Delhi-Meerut RRTS train set ready, to be handed over on May 7
389.article_body: The first train set of the Delhi-Meerut Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) is ready and will be handed over to the National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) on May 7. RRTS' train sets will be brought to Ghaziabad's Duhai depot. NCRTC said the train sets' manufacturing facility in Gujarat will deliver 210 cars for the first RRTS corridor.

390.title: CAA will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends: Amit Shah
390.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah while addressing a public rally in West Bengal's Siliguri on Thursday said the Citizenship (Amendment) Act (CAA) will be implemented the moment COVID-19 pandemic ends. He said, "TMC is spreading rumours about CAA that it won't be implemented on the ground." Shah further said, "Mamata Didi wants infiltration...CAA was, is and will be a reality."

391.title: Big B & I used to discuss his films during 'Runway 34' shoot: Rakul
391.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh, talking about working with Amitabh Bachchan in 'Runway 34', has said, "I had a lot of discussions with him about his experience of the films that he has shot." She stated that both of them used to talk about his COVID-19 recovery, and his experience while shooting for 'Agneepath' and 'Coolie'. 'Runway 34' also featured Ajay Devgn.

392.title: Bihar at bottom of ladder in every index: Prashant Kishor
392.article_body: Political strategist Prashant Kishor said that Bihar is at the bottom of the ladder in every index, adding that the state can't achieve the heights of development on the path it has taken so far. Over the next few months, Kishor said, he would interact with 18,000 people, both political and non-political, he met through his previous activities in Bihar.

393.title: BJP planning to demolish 2,000 unauthorised colonies in Delhi: AAP
393.article_body: Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia on Thursday alleged that the BJP, which is ruling the three civic bodies, was planning to demolish 1,750 unauthorised and 860 slum colonies. In the last 17 years, BJP leaders in the civic bodies, councillors and mayors "amassed money" by allowing illegal construction to flourish only to serve them notices now, Sisodia alleged.

394.title: Mira Road police recover banned gutka products worth ₹15 lakh
394.article_body: A team of Mira Road police seized banned gutka products worth ₹15 lakh on Wednesday. This comes a week after the Mira Road police caught two men transporting gutka products in an auto-rickshaw. Police said they were looking for an absconding accused when they found the products. We are trying to ascertain the main source and supply chain, police added.

395.title: Mumbai man stabs woman & constable who came to help her, arrested
395.article_body: A 31-year-old man from Mumbai was arrested for allegedly stabbing a 25-year-old woman and an on-duty police constable who came to help her in Wadala. Police said that the accused and his family had contacted the woman's family with a marriage proposal, which they rejected and this angered the accused. The woman and the constable suffered deep wounds, police added.

396.title: Apologise to North Indians before entering Ayodhya: BJP MP to MNS chief
396.article_body: BJP MP Brijbhushan Sharan Singh has said he won't allow MNS chief Raj Thackeray to enter Ayodhya until he apologises to North Indians for his remarks made against them in 2008. "We have been watching since 2008, they brought to the fore the issue of 'Marathi Manush'," the MP added. Thackeray has announced his visit to Ayodhya on June 5.

397.title: Class 1 student crushed to death by bus on school premises in UP
397.article_body: A six-year-old Class 1 student died after a school bus rammed into him on the premises of Royal Convent Inter College in UP's Baghpat on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred when the bus driver was reversing the vehicle. The victim's body has been sent for post-mortem and an FIR has been registered against the school manager and the driver.

398.title: Over 600 Ukrainian fighters killed in artillery strikes: Russia
398.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said on Thursday that over 600 Ukrainian fighters were killed after its artillery struck multiple Ukrainian positions and strongholds overnight. It added that 61 units of weapons and military equipment were also destroyed in the artillery strikes. Meanwhile, Ukraine has accused that Russia is "resorting to the missile terrorism tactics to spread fear across Ukraine".

399.title: DGCA starts night checks of airplanes following SpiceJet flight turbulence
399.article_body: DGCA has initiated surprise night checks to assess the fitness of aircrafts across several airports following recent turbulence on SpiceJet's Mumbai-Durgapur flight. DGCA has directed teams to examine cockpits, cabins and check for potential safety hazards like loose fittings of aircraft seats and windows. "If airlines are found [violating] rules, they're liable to pay heavy penalties," it said.

400.title: Kanye was upset because I called him rapper during SNL monologue: Kim
400.article_body: Kim Kardashian, during an episode of 'The Kardashians', has revealed the reason why her ex-husband Kanye West was "upset" by her Saturday Night Live (SNL) monologue. "Kanye wished I said the word 'filed' for divorce...he was upset that I also said he was a rapper. He said, 'I'm...much more than a rapper...can't believe you said rapper," Kim told Khloé Kardashian.
